subject: Applications are now open for the Women's Mentoring Co-op
body:
APPLY TODAY
 
 
 
Greetings,
We’re excited to announce that applications are now open for 
Cohort 19
 of the 
Women’s Mentoring Co-op
, running 
July – December 2025!
Since 2016, the Women’s Mentoring Co-op has been a place where women 
connect, innovate, and grow.
 Join a 
supportive community 
that will empower you, strengthen your leadership skills, and accelerate your personal and professional growth.
Apply by April 30 
to be paired with a mentor and become part of a
 dynamic network of inspiring women.
There is no fee to apply!
 If selected, there is a $350 enrollment fee to participate. Limited need-based scholarships are available—please see the application for more details.
 
 
APPLY TODAY
 
 
1200+
 
 
women have participated to date
 
 
 
Top Reasons to Apply
 
INTENTIONAL MENTORSHIP: 
Gain a mentor specifically chosen to help you achieve your goals and accelerate your growth
 
EXCLUSIVE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT: 
Access workshops designed to enhance your leadership skills and career progression
 
VIBRANT COMMUNITY: 
Join a powerful network of over 1,200 women innovators throughout Chicagoland
 
EXPANDED NETWORKING: 
Attend Chicago Innovation events and enjoy a 6-month membership ($200 value) to grow your connections
 
SUPPORTIVE ECOSYSTEM:
 
Learn, grow, and thrive within a community committed to empowering your success
 
 
 
 
Top Areas of Impact for Mentees
 
Gained confidence 
Gained an ally to help grow personally & professionally 
Increased network 
Enhanced leadership skills 
Insight into career planning 
Tips to navigate difficult situations at work
APPLY TO BE A MENTEE TODAY
 
 
Insights from the Women's Mentoring 
﻿
Co-op Past Mentees
 
 
 
"Not only is she someone I admire professionally, but she is also someone that re-energizes me after our calls."
 
﻿ 
﻿
– Past Mentee
"She has really provided me with great guidance and allowed me to focus on very specific goals. Great mentoring!" 
﻿
﻿
– Past Mentee
 
Examples of Past and 
Current Mentors 
 
 
...and many more to come!
 
Thank you to our Women's Mentoring 
﻿
Co-op Sponsors
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Become a Sponsor 
 
 
Contact Laura LeClair at 
lauraj@chicagoinnovation.com
 
for details!

subject: Applications are now open for The Ladder
body:
APPLY TODAY
 
 
 
Dear Ashton,
 
We’re thrilled to announce that 
applications are now open for Cohort 8 of The Ladder
, running from 
July to December 2025
!
Founded in 2022 in partnership with
 i.c. stars,
 The Ladder supports Black and Latine innovators taking their next big step. Whether you're an 
emerging leader, founder, or bold visionary, 
The Ladder is here to support your journey! 
Apply by April 30 
to join a thriving community of innovators and be paired with a dedicated mentor ready to 
support your growth, amplify your vision, and accelerate your career.
There is no fee to apply! 
If selected, there is a $350 enrollment fee to participate. 
Limited need-based scholarships are available—please see the application for more details.
 
 
APPLY NOW
 
 
350
 
 
people have participated to date 
 
 
 
Top Reasons to Apply
 
ONE-ON-ONE MENTORSHIP:  
Get matched with Chicago leaders committed to your growth and career advancement
 
EXCLUSIVE EVENTS & WORKSHOPS: 
Access to program specific sessions focused on career development, connection, and community-building
 
PREMIUM NETWORKING OPPORTUNITIES: 
Receive a 6-month Chicago Innovation Membership ($200 value) to attend monthly large events, plus access to quarterly i.c. stars events
 
CROSS-INDUSTRY CONNECTIONS: 
Network with professionals across industries and career stages throughout the Chicago region
 
SUPPORTIVE COMMUNITY: 
Join a powerful network dedicated to uplifting and empowering your growth and success
 
 
BECOME A MENTEE
 
 
Insights from The Ladder Mentees

subject: Join us on April 30th for Chicago Innovation Award Winners Tell It All
body:
Dear Ashton,
 
Out of 420 Chicago Innovation Awards winners since 2002, 98% are still in business. 73 have been acquired with exit values exceeding $158 billion! And that's just a snapshot of their impact.
This event gathers some of the most successful winners for an up-close-and-personal conversation:
- Lessons learned firsthand from some incredible journeys
- Unfiltered advice on how to scale a growing business
- Innovative strategies used to turn visions into reality
We hope you can join us, 
Luke Tanen, President and CEO, Chicago Innovation
Tom Kuczmarski, Co-founder, Chicago Innovation
Paul Kitti, VP of Marketing & Events, Chicago Innovation
﻿

subject: Microlearning That Matters: Join Fellow CLOs for a Strategy Reset
body:
The idea of helping employees do their jobs better with the aid of bite-sized learning seems like a no-brainer. But do typical uses of microlearning really improve employees’ skills over time?
View in browser
 
 
SECURE YOUR SPOT
 
What It Really Takes to Get Long-Term Value from Microlearning
 
TODAY | 12:00 PM EDT (11:00 AM CDT) | 1 hour
While bite-sized learning seems intuitive for today's time-pressed workforce, the reality is more nuanced. Many organizations invest heavily in microlearning only to see minimal skill improvement over time.
 
In this hands-on workshop
, you'll discover: 
Why common microlearning approaches fail to create sustainable skill development 
The critical design elements that transform fleeting interactions into durable learning 
Practical frameworks for measuring microlearning's impact on performance metrics 
How leading organizations are reimagining microlearning for long-term value 
As learning leaders, we must move beyond engagement metrics and focus on lasting capability building. 
This workshop will challenge conventional thinking and provide actionable strategies for maximizing your microlearning ROI. 
 
REGISTER NOW
 ➡️ 
Bring your team and your questions—this interactive session addresses your microlearning challenges.

APPLY TODAY

applications are now open for Cohort 14 of Ageless Innovators
, running from 
July to December 2025
!
We believe everyone, regardless of age, has something valuable to teach and something new to learn. 
Whether you’re a 
seasoned leader
, 
emerging professional
, 
entrepreneur
, 
creative thinker
, or 
lifelong learner

gain fresh perspectives and build meaningful connections across generations
.
Since 2019, 
Chicago Innovation and The Village Chicago

RRF Foundation for Aging

Apply by April 30

There is no fee to apply! 
If selected, there’s a $200 enrollment fee to participate.
 
 
APPLY NOW
 
 
450+
 
 
people have participated to this date 
 
 
 
Top Reasons to Apply

: 
Share your knowledge and learn from others across generations, fostering mutual growth.

:

COMMUNITY

Gain access to valuable resources, including a 6-month Chicago Innovation Membership ($200 value) and a Village Chicago Membership ($540 value), fostering connections with a supportive network.

subject: Chicago Innovation Monthly – March Edition
body:
Videos From 
Chicago On Innovation
Leading as a Woman
 
Fighting for Women in Business
 
 
Making Change for Women as a Business Leader 
 
Challenges Facing a Woman Politician and Entrepreneur 
 
 
 
 
 
 
We are excited to announce that applications for Cohort 19 of the Women's Mentoring Co-op will open on
 March 25
! If you are looking for a mentor or know a woman who may be interested in joining our next cohort, encourage them to apply when applications open! 
The next cohort will run from
 July - December 2025
. 
﻿
Apply by the end of the day on 
April 30
 to be paired with a fantastic mentor who can help you navigate today's unique challenges, grow as a person, and accelerate your career.
 
Insights from the Women's Mentoring Co-op Community
 
 
 
“It’s the perfect program to get more connected to Chicago’s innovation community.”
– 
Leslie Vickrey, Founder and CEO, Clearedge Marketing
“My mentor helped me become the leader and executive I wanted to be.”
– 
Sarah-Eva Marchese, CEO, Floracracy
“My business has literally grown 4x since the Women’s Mentoring Co-op
.
”
– 
Reva Minkoff, Founder and President, Digital4Startups
 
Learn more about the Women's Mentoring Co-op
 
 
Chicago Innovation Monthly Poll
In the February poll, we asked: "Which Black innovator has had the most significant impact on Food Innovation?" Lloyd Augustus Hall received the most votes for inventing chemical preservatives and techniques to extend food shelf life.
What's the most effective way to advance women leaders in Chicago?
Building strong mentorship and networking communities
 
Investing in education and training for emerging women leaders
 
Advancing representation in leadership positions
 
Supporting professional development resources
 
Creating accessible funding and investment opportunities
 
 
Upcoming Chicago Innovation Events
 
To create transformational opportunities for the Chicago region, we need bold thinking, 
﻿
new vision and daring leaders. Join us on March 19th to hear top business and civic leaders discuss a fresh approach to the future of our city:
- Learn from inspired leaders who are charting a new growth path for Chicago
- Meet the leading organizations in Chicago's innovation ecosystem
 
The event will spotlight some of the most successful and impactful Chicago Innovation Award winners of our past 23 years sharing their insights, lessons learned and authentic perspectives on what it takes to start and scale an innovative growing business, through an up close and personal panel discussion.
Get tickets 
 
Save the date
 
 
 
We're proud to honor these women-led winners of the 2024 Chicago Innovation Awards: Disability Lead, Chicago Chefs Cook, Cook County Bureau of Economic Development, DeVry University, Dimension Inx, Springrose, True Star, Reach, and First Women’s Bank.
 
 
2024 Chicago Innovation Award Winning Women-Led Organizations
 
 
Disability Lead has established an innovative approach to increasing civic engagement and diverse leadership by developing and elevating a network of more than 220 leaders with disabilities. With Disability Lead’s support and active identification, its members strengthen disability representation in positions of power and influence, increasing equity, inclusion, and economic opportunity for all. Disability Lead’s proven track record of shifting power to individuals who live at the intersection of marginalized identities demonstrates that people with disabilities are well-suited to tackle systemic problems that have the largest impacts on the most vulnerable. Founded in Chicago, other regions across the nation are attracted to its approach, and Disability Lead is now embarking on a new journey to replicate and expand the model.
 
 
Chicago Chefs Cook is a non-profit humanitarian organization serving as an unprecedented platform for chefs and restaurateurs to fundraise for humanitarian causes important to culinarians and their diners. The efforts of Chicago Chefs Cook extend the role of chefs in the Chicagoland area from purveyors of culture-rich culinary experiences to multi-dimensional civic leaders. In this way, the organization amplifies the sphere of impact that chefs uniquely create and unlocks deeper points of connectivity between chefs, diners, and community members. The result is a more invested city that shows up for each other, with chefs, and food, serving as the vital connective tissue that binds us all.
 
 
With the onset of COVID-19, Cook County partnered with the Illinois Manufacturing Excellence Center (IMEC) to conduct a historic outreach and census of suburban Cook County manufacturers to assess the pandemic’s impact on their businesses. Manufacturing Reinvented utilizes technical assistance from IMEC to help manufacturers address these identified priorities. Eligible projects cover themes such as market growth, workforce training, operational improvements, and leadership, all aligned with survey results.
 
 
Careers in technology have long been dominated by men: despite making up approximately half of the U.S. workforce, only around 29% of technology sector workers identify as female. With more than 4,000 students enrolled to date, the Women+Tech Scholars Program is designed to empower women pursuing careers in technology to reach their breakthrough moments. The program’s educational offerings, resources, and professional networks help narrow employment and advancement gaps for women in tech-related roles. In addition to learning opportunities, scholars receive career guidance, financial support, and real-world work experience through a community of passionate advocates—many of whom started in the same place as the learners today.
 
 
Hyperelastic Bone® represents a new generation of regenerative biomaterials that leverages a unique approach to restoring functionality in the body through a dynamic collaboration between biology and 3D-printed biomaterials. The first product made from this novel technology is CMFlex™, a ready-to-use bone graft substitute and the first 3D-printed regenerative bone product cleared by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for facial reconstruction applications. CMFlex offers a safe and effective alternative to traditional bone grafts—one that can save valuable time during surgical procedures and transform the current standard of care.
 
 
The Springrose Mobility Bra™ is the world’s most versatile bra, thoughtfully designed for women who have limited mobility due to injury, illness, disability, or aging. For those who struggle with traditional bras, its innovative modular design offers over eight different ways to put it on — including one-handed, stepping in, or overhead — allowing women to dress painlessly, independently, and with dignity. Despite its innovative functionality, the Mobility Bra™ remains stylish, comfortable, and pacemaker-safe, and is available in the most inclusive size range in the adaptive intimates category. With a granted utility and design patent from the USPTO and patents pending internationally, it redefines what’s possible for apparel.
 
 
True Star’s innovative social enterprise tackles critical challenges by offering transformative education and hands-on training in media arts and digital marketing to local youth. Their comprehensive curriculum spans journalism, video production, digital marketing, and more, equipping local youth with the essential skills to thrive in the digital age. 
 
 
REACH Pathways bridges the opportunity gap for under-resourced learners by combining game-based learning with AI-powered tools to build leadership and career skills. REACH provides learners with personalized support, financial resources, and a community that drives success in education and careers. 
 
 
Founded in 2021, First Women’s Bank is the only commercial bank in the country with a strategic focus on supporting the women’s economy and closing the gender lending gap. To execute this mission, we recruit deposits from individuals, organizations, and corporations that share our vision. These funds are then strategically deployed to ﬁnance small businesses, with a focus on supporting the women’s economy. We recognize that small businesses are the backbone of our economy, and we are committed to providing the capital they need to succeed. Banking with FWB means becoming part of a community that deeply understands and is committed to growing the economy and the role of women within it.
View all 2024 Chicago Innovation Award Winners 
 
 
 
Celebrating the women of the Chicago Innovation team and 
﻿
all the work they do for the innovation community
 
 
 
Rosalyn King 
Vice President — Finance & Operations
Laura Jordan LeClair
Director — Mentoring and Inclusion Programs
Anna Aguiar Kosicki
Senior Coordinator of Events and Programs
 
 
 
Malak Mekha 
Social Media Coordinator 
Molly Seedhouse
Director — Illinois Student Invention Convention 
Galyna Kravets
Graphic Designer
 
 
 
 
Chicago Innovation Fellows Second Session
On February 25th, 
Chicago Innovation Fellows gathered for an impactful second session. The day began with Kellogg Professor Mohan Sawhney presenting on "Growth Through Focus" and "Digital Disruption."
Kellogg Professor Will Towns followed with an enlightening session on "Innovating for Society." The afternoon featured a thought-provoking panel discussion on growth strategies and digital transformation, moderated by Tom Kuczmarski and featuring industry leaders Sid Bala, Nancy Ruscheinski, Tope Sadiku, and Sandee Kastrul. The day concluded with collaborative work sessions, where Fellows provided feedback on each other's capstone projects, fostering community and advancing their innovation initiatives.
 
 
Kicking Off 2025 with AI + IQ Event
On February 26th, we had an incredible start to the year at our AI+IQ event, bringing together some of the brightest minds in artificial intelligence to discuss AI trends for 2025, the technology's impact today, and what the future holds. The event was sold-out with 350 registrants! 
From thought-provoking insights to meaningful networking, the event sparked discussions on how AI will continue transforming industries and our daily lives in ways we never imagined. A huge thank you to our expert panelists (left to right): 
Erik Brown
 - Senior Partner, Emerging Tech & AI, West Monroe
Bich-Thuy Le - President & Founder, LeLumin
Hardik Bhatt - President & CEO, SDI Presence
Kris Hammond - Professor, Northwestern University & Co-founder, Narrative Science
Amanda Kranz - Moderator & Chicago Office Managing Director, Accenture
Special thanks to the School of the Art Institute of Chicago for hosting us in their stunning Grand Ballroom!
 
Volunteer at the 2025 Illinois Student Invention Convention! 
We will be celebrating Illinois' top inventors in K-8th grade on May 3rd and would love your support in making the day a huge success! The celebration includes workshops, a showcase, and an award ceremony. 
Volunteering sign-ups are now open
, so register today to get involved.
 
 
Chicago Chefs Cook 'I Cook For' Benefit 2025
Join Chicago Chefs Cook, a women co-founded 2024 Chicago Innovation Award winner, for their 'I Cook For' Benefit at the Four Seasons Hotel on March 20th. This special event celebrates the representative chefs who shape our city's culinary identity, highlighting the deeper meaning behind their craft— what they "cook for," what they stand for, and the impact they strive to make every day.
Purchase tickets and learn more
 
 
 
Welcome New 2025 Chicago Innovation Sponsors 
 
 
 
 
 
May 22nd, 2017 – An attendee at the 3rd annual "Celebrating Women in Innovation" poses a question to the all-star panel that included (left to right, with 2017 titles) 
Ana Dutra - CEO of the Executives' Club of Chicago; 
Toni Preckwinkle - Cook County Board President; 
Andrea Zopp - Chicago Deputy Mayor; 
Danielle DuMerer - CIO for the City of Chicago; and 
﻿Mary Ellen Weber - former NASA astronaut.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
      
      
      
 
 
Chicago Innovation | 
2001 N Halsted
 Suite 201 | 
Chicago, IL 60614 US
Unsubscribe
 | 
Update Profile
 |

subject: Top 10 Reasons Why You Shouldn't Miss Next Week
body:
Transform 2025 starts next Monday, March 17 and there are so many reasons why you should be there. Check out why.
 
Hi, Hannah!
 
We are just days from Transform 2025 - where the brightest minds in the future of work will come together to tackle the industry's most pressing challenges and shape the next era of work.
 
If you haven't joined our incredible lineup of people leaders, investors, and entrepreneurs yet, 
there's still time
.
10 Reasons You Can't Miss Transform 2025
1. Join Your People
Connect, learn, and be inspired by people-first leaders from top companies like 
Airbnb, Dropbox, Redpoint Ventures, Riot Games, UPS, WebMD
, and more who are leading the charge in reshaping the future of people + work.
2. An Experience Beyond the Sessions in the EXP
An immersive space to connect, recharge, and explore, you'll meet top technology solution providers, grab a coffee, enjoy live podcast recordings, and refresh with a new headshot. Unwind in the Wellness Lounge, network over wine, learn in interactive Learning Labs, and take a break with puppies. Every moment is designed for connection and discovery.
 
3. The Transform Awards: Honoring Industry Changemakers
On March 18th, witness the Transform Awards Community Celebration, where we recognize the top leaders and organizations transforming the workplace. Celebrate the winners of 
The Transform 10
 and groundbreaking category awards like 
DEI Initiative of the Year
, 
People Reporting & Insights of the Year
, and 
Transformative Tech of the Year
.
 
4. Sessions & Experiences That Challenge the Status Quo
Get ready for thought-provoking main-stage conversations, tactical breakouts, and immersive experiences designed to spark ideas and action. Hear from powerhouse speakers like 
Ursula Burns 
and
 Brian Baker,
 and participate in hands-on workshops that will elevate your leadership, strategy, and impact.
 
5. Private Screening of "LILLY" 
Kick-off Transform with an exclusive community experience featuring a private screening of 
LILLY
 on March 16th or 17th. This powerful story will spark conversations on leadership, equity, and resilience.
 
6. Connect with a Global Community
Attending Transform allows you to meet chapter leaders from across the globe, including our newly launched US Chapters, and become part of a network of forward-thinking professionals.
 
7. Attendee Perks & Concierge Service
Whether you're new to Transform 2025 or an OG, we’ve got you covered. Our dedicated conference concierge service by 
Overalls
 and first-time attendee sessions ensures you maximize your experience. From curated meetups to 1:1 networking, you can schedule in the conference app; you'll walk in feeling like a VIP and walk out with long-lasting connections.
 
 
8. Unmatched Value
You'll walk away with new relationships and resources, a fresh understanding of the direction the workforce is heading in, and insights into the technology leading the way.
 
9. 
Office Hours
Stop by to connect with a curated group of investors from ADP Ventures, AI Fund, FoW Partners, JFFVentures, OMERS Ventures, PeopleTech Invest, SemperVirens Venture Capital, Unum Ventures, Workday Ventures, and more!
 
10. P
arty with Timbaland
Closeout Transform 2025 in style with an exclusive after-party featuring a legendary performance by the one and only Timbaland, brought to us by 
Greenhouse
, 
Guardian
, and 
HiBob
! Get ready for iconic beats, nonstop energy, and a night you won’t forget.
Join Us! 
Thank You to Our Sponsors
 
Transform 2025 would not be possible without the generous support of our sponsoring companies. 
A special thank you to our 
Title Sponsors: AceUp, Deloitte, Rippling, Sequoia, Sparrow, Transcarent
. 
View all Sponsors.
 
As a newsletter subscriber, take an additional $200 off using this special link to register. 
Save Your Seat
.
 
Looking forward to seeing you soon!
 
Warm wishes,
Samara Jaffe
Co-Founder & General Manager
Transform
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Transform Media LLC, 1850 Gateway Drive, Suite 700, San Mateo, CA 94404

subject: 45 Minutes That Will Transform Your L&D Operations: AI Efficiency Webinar
body:

View in browser

Eliminating L&D bottlenecks:
How AI is fixing learning inefficiencies

Industry Leaders Share Real-World Solutions

You'll discover

The most common operational bottlenecks slowing down L&D teams today

A real-world case study demonstrating AI-powered automation in action

subject: Today's Leadership: What's Required?
body:
Out & Equal’s March 2025 Newsletter
 
 
 
Today's Leadership: What's Required?
 
Out & Equal is less than two weeks away from hosting the 
2025 Leadership Forum
. As we finalize our programming for Partners, our north star is: 
what will it take to lead in these unprecedented times?
 
From work teams and Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) or Business Resource Groups (BRGs), to an entire organization or community, leadership plays an integral role in: 
setting a vision and defining a compelling and community-centered path forward where no one is left behind; 
listening, validating, and meeting people where they are to hear and acknowledge concerns–even when you might not have clear answers; and 
building cultures of trust and support where mistakes are acknowledged, learned from, and tackled together. 
When any of these areas begin to lag, especially in times when there are other stressors or confusion, that is when challenges and gaps develop, and profound fear can exacerbate. 
So, in this age when there is so much turmoil and so much at stake, where do we go from here? How can leaders instill confidence, trust, and support? What does leadership need to look like today? 
Authenticity, transparency, and inclusion are key. 
People are looking for leaders who speak truth and admit mistakes or knowledge gaps, level set and take a commonsense approach to issues, and build cultures that foster inclusion, which tap into the potential of us all. 
 
Be bold and empathetic. 
Being an effective leader means having the support to realize your vision. Meeting people where they are, acknowledging their experiences, and bringing them on a journey—as opposed to pushing them down a path—builds trust and respect all while yielding better business results.  
 
Remain mission-focused. 
Be disciplined in remaining focused on your highest goals and opportunities ahead. Do not let the immediacy of the current storm cloud your judgement and decision-making. Stay focused, remain committed to your values, support your teams, and keep pushing forward. 
 
In these times of upheaval, effective, strong, and inclusive leadership is the most strategic formula to uplift individuals, teams, and entire organizations. It instills confidence, hope, and trust. It reminds people that they matter and someone, through the hardships and victories, has their back. 
At Out & Equal, that is the type of leadership we bring to the table to our more than 330 Partner organizations. We serve as confidantes, thought partners, and strategic advisors. We’re there to work in true partnership to improve workplaces, optimize culture, and advance their business, talent and culture objectives. 
To all the leaders out there, emerging and seasoned, here is my closing message to you all: keep listening, keep learning, and keep growing. Remember your north star. And remember the power of community. As a CEO, I am inspired by all of you building, in partnership with us, towards the Business of Belonging.  
 
 
 
 
 
Celebrating Women’s History Month: Firsts Are Essential. Seconds Are Critical. Movements Must Be Intentional.
 
As we kick off Women’s History Month, it’s key we acknowledge the challenges all 
women—particularly Queer women, transgender women, and women of color—have and continue to face in the workplace and beyond. 
To ensure the growth and success of our teams, organizations, and communities, we must invest in all women. We must create inclusive spaces where their voices are heard and amplified. We must acknowledge, recognize, and respect their unique experiences and identities. And we must address our own biases and show up as authentic allies. 
Now more than ever, allies–especially if you are a “first” to anyone around you or looking up to you
–
must pull people in and up, so that we can keep walking forward together as a community and build firsts and seconds into a movement.
Read More
 
 
 
Recognizing, Honoring, and Celebrating Transgender Day of Visibility (March 31)
Transgender and nonbinary people have made our communities and society stronger with contributions that have shaped business, technology, and culture. Across movements and moments, the community has pushed the cause of equality forward for all people. 
 
As transgender and nonbinary people face systemic attacks, discrimination, and erasure, allies and the broader LGBTQ+ community have common ground to stand up for and alongside our transgender and nonbinary community authentically and intentionally. 
 
On Transgender Day of Visibility and beyond, what can you do to support the community and elevate the conversation?
Familiarize yourself with transgender history and transgender heroes in our movement. 
Learn about who they are and 
how they have made our world a better, stronger place
.
 
 
Be an authentic ally. Leverage your individual sphere of influence to drive change. 
Elevate their work and read their stories
. 
 
 
 
Don’t Miss Out! Registration Closes Soon for the 2025 Out & Equal Leadership Forum
Leadership Forum, taking place from 
March 17-19
, is a moment to break through the noise and focus on the insights, learnings, and connections that will deliver measurable and lasting progress for you, your teams, and your organization.
﻿
H
ighly customized program tracks will engage and empower change agents at all levels while clearly reinforcing the value of inclusion and belonging in driving key business strategies forward.
Register Now
 
Note: 
For Out & Equal Partners that are Copper and above, additional Leadership Forum registrations are available to purchase. For more information, please reach out to your Partner Success Manager or email 
Partnerships@outandequal.org
.
 
 
Driving Impact Across the Globe
Out & Equal Partnership includes access to an expanded lineup of in-person and virtual professional development, networking, and community-building opportunities as well as tailored Global Impact Programs in APAC, LATAM, London, and the US Southern States. 
Last month, in Manila and London, we convened hundreds of C-suite leaders, strategists, and HR practitioners for powerful discussions focused on:
 
How to optimize workplace cultures in a time of change, complexity, and uncertainty.
The value of inclusion and belonging in advancing key business objectives like talent retention, brand loyalty, and innovation.
﻿
Why a “glocal” approach to this work is key to maximizing impact and driving change.
These convenings are only the beginning. We'll continue to engage with our Partners in the US and the globe at roundtables, forums, and symposiums.
See the full list of upcoming events.
Learn More
 
 
 
Building Community and Professional Networks
Did you know that Out & Equal has a Career Network Group on LinkedIn with over 5700 members?   
 
We invite you, your talent acquisition teams, and any professionals in your network or organization who are interested in posting or learning about opportunities including: job openings, networking, upskill events, learning and development, and other events and activities related to workplace belonging or your organization to join the group.
Join Now!
 
 
 
Welcome to our New Partners!
At Out & Equal, we work with the world's leading and most influential companies—and the inclusive leaders at these organizations—to advance LGBTQ+ inclusion and belonging in the workplace.  
 
We’re proud to welcome 
CapTech Consulting
, 
JCPenney
, 
Nestle USA
, 
NFP
, and 
Parexel
 as our newest members of the Out & Equal Partner Community.
 
 
 
Partner in the Business of Belonging™
Through expert consultation and thought leadership, learning and development, and transformative events, becoming an Out & Equal Partner will help strengthen and future-proof your business. 
 
Learn More
 
 
FOLLOW US
  
  
  
  
 
 
outandequal.org

subject: 2025’s Leadership Imperative: Data, AI, and Financial Agility
body:
The New Executive Playbook
View in browser
Dear Ashton,
 
As organizations face economic uncertainty, AI-driven transformation, and shifting workforce expectations, one challenge remains constant: how to develop leaders who can navigate complexity and drive business success.
For senior learning and talent leaders, ensuring executives have the right mix of financial acumen, strategic agility, and AI fluency is critical. The latest research highlights three key leadership shifts that learning and development (L&D) leaders should prioritize in their executive education strategies.
 
Three Critical Shifts Defining Leadership in 2025
📌 
Pricing Strategy as a Leadership Competency
According to Forbes, companies that leverage data-driven pricing strategies achieve higher profitability and customer loyalty. As organizations invest in leadership development, training executives in behavioral economics, AI-driven pricing models, and value-based decision-making will be a competitive advantage.
Read More:
 
Forbes – The CEO’s Guide to Pricing
 
📌 
Reimagining Finance Strategy for Business Agility
The ability to think strategically about financial decisions is no longer limited to CFOs. HR, L&D, and business leaders need to understand finance at a high level to support growth, workforce investments, and long-term planning. For L&D leaders, this means ensuring executives and high-potential talent are equipped with the financial literacy to connect business strategy with financial decision-making.
Read More:
 
Gartner – How to Create a Better Finance Strategy
 
📌 
AI is Reshaping Leadership—Are Executives Prepared?
AI adoption is accelerating, but most organizations lack leaders who understand how to integrate AI into workforce strategies. McKinsey research shows that while 70% of companies are increasing AI investments, only a fraction are developing leaders who can harness AI to drive productivity and innovation. Talent leaders must prioritize executive education that develops AI literacy, human-AI collaboration skills, and digital transformation strategies to future-proof their workforce.
Read More:
 
McKinsey – Empowering People to Unlock AI’s Full Potential
 
How Learning & Talent Leaders Are Preparing Their Workforces
To navigate these challenges, leading organizations are rethinking their leadership development strategies and investing in executive education programs that equip leaders with financial, strategic, and AI-driven decision-making skills.
 
From Our Sponsor:
 
Chicago Booth Executive Education
 is at the forefront of 
helping organizations build resilient, forward-thinking leadership pipelines.
 Programs focused on 
pricing strategy, financial decision-making, and digital innovation
 empower executives with the tools needed to lead effectively in today’s complex business landscape.
 
📥 
Download the 2025 Executive Education Catalog
 to explore how organizations are developing leaders for the future. 
Access the Catalog
 
Best,
 
Ashley St. John
Editor in Chief

subject: The scariest seven words in corporate life...
body:
Hi Hannah,
Imagine this. You’re sitting in a meeting. Everything is fine. Until someone asks…
 
“Hey, were you at Transform this year?”
 
Your heart stops. Your palms sweat. You panic.
 
Because you weren’t.
 
Now, you have 
two 
choices:
Lie.
 Risk being asked a follow-up question that exposes you faster than a bad LinkedIn humblebrag.
Admit you missed it.
 Spend the next 12 months playing catch-up while everyone else is dropping knowledge bombs from 
Google, Airbnb, Redpoint Ventures, Starz, McKesson,
 and other big-name companies that 
were
 there.
Or, you know… you could 
just go and avoid this altogether.
 
Transform isn’t just a conference
.
 It’s where the future of people + work is actually being built. It’s where people-first leaders get real about what’s now and next.
 
So do Future You a favor. Get your ticket before you become 
that
 person in the meeting with nothing to contribute except regret. 
 
Prices go up TONIGHT so don't procrastinate any longer. 
Reserve your spot now and get $200 additional off
.
 
Hope to see you there!
Debra Carney 
Transform | Community
Transform Media LLC, 1850 Gateway Drive, Suite 700, San Mateo, CA 94404

subject: Fair360: Where We're Going
body:
Dear Ashton,
 
I changed the name of my company from DiversityInc to Fair360 two years ago. I saw the anti-DEI movement coming. It's OK, progress requires adaptation and innovation. Change is necessary when, as one example, you have a system where women have earned more than half of bachelor's and master's degree since the 1980s (and earned more than half of PhDs since the 1990s). Despite this, women are only 10% of Fortune 500 CEOs.
 
Focusing on Outcomes
We have moved away from representation to outcomes. Outcomes are expressed for every demographic. This year, we provided every company with a monetary value of their inclusive human resources initiatives - expressed as existing (dollar value) benefit and opportunity (if management of initiatives was improved to that of top-performing companies).
 
Fairness Report Insights
We also provided a fairness report, which conclusively showed that white people are not systematically discriminated against even in companies that had the most robust inclusion initiatives. This is critical. The progress of some cannot come at the penalty of others. The perception that it does is at the root of much anti-DEI sentiment. That said, individual cases of discrimination against white people (and every other group) cannot be denied. No company can absolutely guard itself against the intentional misbehavior of individuals.
 
Optimized Survey
Our survey has been optimized to be more efficient, now containing fewer than 100 questions. We have removed compensation-related inquiries and made supplier outreach and philanthropy optional, ensuring a more focused and relevant experience for participants.
 
Data-Driven Analysis
At the core of our work is data-driven analysis that helps companies quantify the impact of their inclusion efforts. Voluntary turnover, a key indicator of workplace equity, varies significantly across industries—sometimes by a factor of four. This presents an astonishing competitive advantage—or disadvantage. Our data demonstrates that higher turnover is linked to increased bias, making it a critical metric for organizations to monitor given the increasing diversity of workforce demographics.
 
Refined Benchmarking Approach
To help organizations drive measurable progress, we are refining our benchmarking approach, focusing on five key inclusion initiatives: mentorship, sponsorship, high potentials, employee resource groups (ERGs) and executive HR councils. These areas have been identified in our data as essential for improving the quality of recruitment, retention and development. 
 
Commitment to Verified Meritocracy
As workplace dynamics continue to evolve, we are adopting the language of “meritocracy” to reinforce our commitment to fairness and equity across all employee groups. This holistic approach ensures that inclusion efforts are assessed comprehensively. In alignment with this direction, we have secured the domains meritocracy360.com and verifiedmeritocracy.com and are restructuring our online presence accordingly.
 
Flagship Event in NYC
Our flagship event at Cipriani’s Wall Street in New York City on May 6 will reflect this refined strategy. Moving away from rankings and company callouts, the event will focus on mentorship, talent development and real-world learning opportunities. With a special emphasis on first-generation college students, the event will provide mentorship, interviews and discussions on essential topics such as financial literacy, equipping the next generation with the skills they need for long-term success.
 
Through these strategic refinements, we remain committed to delivering data-driven insights, promoting inclusive business practices and fostering a representative pipeline of future leaders.
 
Take the Survey
I encourage you to 
fill out our survey
. There is no deadline. It will be open all year. You will receive a 
free report card
 that will give you a monetary value of your current efforts, and opportunity value of improving your efforts. This is an editorial process, thus protected by New Jersey's shield law. We have not been compelled to comply with a single subpoena since we started to collect data in 2003. There will be no public rankings, but you will receive a private ranking, if interested.
 
Final Thoughts
In closing, my advice to everyone is to ground your work in monetary value, described in absolute terms. You cannot lose a shareholder agreement that way. A boss once told me that "beliefs" have no place in business because a "belief" is an acceptance of an intangible. Business is tangible. If you want to be relevant, be tangible.
 
Thank you,
 
Luke Visconti, 
Founder and Chairman, 
Fair360
Fair360, is a VA-certified and veteran-owned business., It is certified by Disability:IN as a company owned by a person with a disability., 
https://www.fair360.com/
, © Copyright 2024 Fair360

subject: My Approach to Networking Without the Overwhelm
body:
Conferences can feel overwhelming, but I’ve found a way to make them work. How I show up, connect, and keep networking manageable.
Hi Hannah,
 
I’ll be honest: big conferences used to make me nervous. Walking into a room full of people I didn’t know, figuring out how to start conversations, worrying if I’d have anyone to talk to. If that sounds familiar, you’re not alone.
Over the years, I’ve learned how to make networking feel less intimidating and more natural. I even wrote about it for Fast Company, “I’m an introvert; here’s how I network with thousands of people.”
This March, I’ll be at 
Transform 2025
, sharing a sneak peek of my new book, 
The Devil Emails at Midnight
: 
What Good Leaders Can Learn From Bad Bosses
,
 and having the kinds of conversations that make events like this worthwhile. 
 
If you’ve ever felt like conferences aren’t built for you, I promise Transform is different.
If you’re thinking about coming, now is a good time. The price goes up on Friday, February 28th, so it’s a great moment to 
grab your ticket
. 
 
I’d love to see you there and connect in a way that feels right for 
you.
 
Mita Mallick
Wall Street Journal Best-Selling Author | Speaker, Transform 2025
Transform Media LLC, 1850 Gateway Drive, Suite 700, San Mateo, CA 94404

subject: Still Deciding on Transform 2025? Here's the Info You Need Before Prices Go Up
body:
Still on the fence? Get the details, resources, and community connections to decide before the price increases on Friday, Feb. 28th. Plus, join the community for free and start connecting.
 
Hi Hannah,
 
Transform 2025 is weeks away and if you're still deciding whether to attend, we have plenty of resources to help you explore what makes this event so special, what to expect, and how to make the most of it. You can also start connecting with the 
Transform community
 now and build relationships before you even arrive. Ticket 
prices go up on
 
Friday, February 28th
,
 and as a newsletter subscriber
, 
you save an extra $20
0
 on your ticket
, so it's a great time to join us! 
Your Next Connection Starts Here
 
The right connections can change everything. At Transform 2025, you'll be surrounded by 
top leaders, innovators, and decision-makers
 who are shaping the future of people + work. Picture yourself grabbing coffee with someone from 
Google
, exchanging ideas with another person from 
Dropbox
, or meeting someone who could open new doors for you at 
ADP Ventures
. The conversations that happen here are the ones that lead to big opportunities, fresh perspectives, and lasting relationships. If you want to be in the room where it all happens, now is the time to secure your spot before prices go up.
 
Don't miss your chance to be part of it.
 
Save Your Seat
 
Show Up Ready, Stress-Free
 
If you're thinking about Transform 2025, now is the time to lock in your spot!
Attendees get
 access to a live prep session on 
March 5th at 12 pm PT / 3 pm ET
 to make sure they arrive ready to get the most out of the event. 
Maggie Ruvoldt,
 CHRO at LEARN Behavioral and Transform 2025 Speaker, and 
Debra Carney
, Marketing at Transform, will share insider tips on what to expect, what to pack, and how to maximize your time in Las Vegas. This is your chance to get ahead, feel prepared, and ask any questions before the big event.
 
RSVP Now.
Transform Attendee's Thrive Guide
 
Whether you’re heading to Transform 2025 for the first time or returning for another unforgettable experience, this
 Attendee Thrive Guide
 will help you make the most of your time. Get a refresher on why Transform is a must-attend event, top tips for navigating sessions and networking, and answers to common FAQs. Plus, past attendees share their 
must-sees and dos, 
from can’t-miss sessions to the best ways to connect with the right people. This guide is for you if you want to understand why you should attend and also be prepared to maximize every moment
. 
Read Now.
Navigating Your On-Site Experience
 
Once you arrive, you’ll want to hit the ground running. That’s why we’re offering a 
First-Time Attendee Welcome 
on
 Monday, March 17th 
at
 10 am 
and again at
 4 pm
, hosted by 
Maggie Ruvoldt, 
CHRO at LEARN Behavioral 
and
 Tiffany Lanier, 
Keynote Speaker and Catalyst at Change is the Catalyst
. It's an opportunity to meet fellow attendees, get insider tips, and start your Transform 2025 experience on the right foot. 
Check out the full event agenda
. 
Conference Pro-Tips 
 
Networking at a conference can be overwhelming, especially if you’re an introvert. 
Mita Mallick
 shares her personal experience of attending Transform and the strategies that helped her navigate conversations, build lasting connections, and make the most of the event. If you’re feeling unsure about networking, this is a must-read. 
Read Mita's Strategies.
Join the Conversation Early
 
The Transform Community is the perfect place to start making connections now. Meet peers, ask questions, coordinate travel plans, and set up meetups before you even arrive in Las Vegas. If you can’t make it this year, the community keeps you plugged into the latest conversations, insights, and opportunities to connect year-round. 
Join free today
 and start building relationships that will last long after Transform 2025.
 
 
Special Rate
With your Transform newsletter subscriber discount, grab your Transform ticket for a special rate of $1,695 (a savings of $1100 off the onsite price). Passes are transferable, so 
locking in your rate now is risk-free.
 
Register now
.

subject: Transform 2025 is almost here. We hope you’ll join us.
body:
I can’t believe we’re just one month away from Transform 2025! Hotels are filling up fast, and we want to make it as easy as possible for you to join us in Las Vegas on March 17th-19th.
Hi Hannah,
 
Transform 2025
 is just one month away, and we’d love for you to be part of it! On March 17th-19th, your peers will gather in Las Vegas to connect, exchange ideas, and shape the future of people + work together.
If you’ve been thinking about joining us, now’s the time. The hotel room block is filling up fast, and we want to make it as easy as possible for you to lock in your spot.
Here’s what you need to know:
Tickets
 – Grab yours before prices increase next Friday, February 28th 
here
.
Hotels
 – Discounted rooms are almost gone! Book by this Friday, February 21st, or before they sell out 
here
. 
Flights
 – Plan to arrive by Sunday, March 16th to kick off your Transform experience with a Sunday matinee and join us for an exclusive film screening of 
Lilly
. We’ve secured flight discounts through United and Southwest. Book your airfare 
here
.
There’s nothing quite like being in the room with the leaders driving real change. Whether you're looking to make connections, discover new ideas, or bring fresh insights back to your team, Transform 2025 is the place to be. This year will be powerful and impactful on a human level, with conversations that will stay with you long after the event.
Please feel free to reach out to me directly with any questions or concerns. I hope to see you at Transform 2025 next month!
Warm wishes,
Samara

subject: Chicago Innovation Monthly – February Edition
body:
Videos From Chicago On Innovation
Importance of Diversity in 
﻿
the Workplace
 
Cultural Influence on New Products & Startups
 
 
Diversity & Workplace 
﻿
Power Dynamics
 
Mentoring 
﻿
Relationships
 
 
 
 
 
 
The Ladder Cohort 7 Mentors
 
A Mentor's Insight
“The Ladder impacts the professional and personal growth of people of color by increasing opportunities to share social capital, networks and resources to further support each other’s endeavors.”
– Shannon Claiborne, 
Sr. Director of Strategic Initiatives; Founder & Principal Trainer
 at Chicago Youth Centers & Strong Community Collective 
 
Learn more about The Ladder
 
 
 
Chicago Innovation Monthly Poll
In the January poll, we asked: In what area do you think Chicago will see the most growth in innovation in 2025? The top answer was Food Innovation.
Which Black innovator has had the most significant impact on Food Innovation?
Madeline M. Turner invented the Turner’s Fruit-Press
 
George Washington Carver created 325 uses for peanuts, 108 for sweet potatoes, 75 for pecans
 
Joseph Lee invented a device to turn stale bread into breadcrumbs and a bread machine
 
Lloyd Augustus Hall invented chemical preservatives and techniques to extend food shelf life
 
 
Upcoming Chicago Innovation Events
 
On February 26th, we'll convene top experts at the cutting edge of artificial intelligence. Listen, learn and network to discover the latest in AI: 
– Top AI trends for 2025
– How this evolving technology can advance you today
– What’s next: How AI will shape our lives in ways once unimaginable
 
To create transformational opportunities for the Chicago region, we need bold thinking, new vision and daring leaders. Join us on March 19th to hear top business and civic leaders discuss a fresh approach to the future of our city:
- Learn from inspired leaders who are charting a new growth path for Chicago
- Meet the leading organizations in Chicago's innovation ecosystem
Get tickets
 
Get tickets 
 
 
 
We're proud to honor Black-led organizations, Cook County Bureau of Economic Development, Feeding America, Rapunzl, True Star and Reach, that won the 2024 Chicago Innovation Awards.
 
 
2024 Chicago Innovation Award Winning Black-Led Organizations
 
 
With the onset of COVID-19, Cook County partnered with the Illinois Manufacturing Excellence Center (IMEC) to conduct a historic outreach and census of suburban Cook County manufacturers to assess the pandemic’s impact on their businesses. Manufacturing Reinvented utilizes technical assistance from IMEC to help manufacturers address these identified priorities. Eligible projects cover themes such as market growth, workforce training, operational improvements, and leadership, all aligned with survey results.
 
 
Feeding America worked with Red Foundry to develop the
 MealConnect Mobile App. It provides food banks, food pantries, and food donors with real-time donation information, schedule/logistics management, and communication tools that increase efficiency in the food rescue process. It proactively connects hyper-local donor and pantry partners with a national reach. 
 
 
True Star’s innovative social enterprise tackles critical challenges by offering transformative education and hands-on training in media arts and digital marketing to local youth. Their comprehensive curriculum spans journalism, video production, digital marketing, and more, equipping local youth with the essential skills to thrive in the digital age. 
 
 
Rapunzl’s gamified financial literacy platform provides students with a real-time investment simulator to manage a $10,000 stock portfolio on their smartphones and Chromebooks. The app is paired with a comprehensive personal finance curriculum that is geared towards middle and high school students to help them unlock the world of finance and investing. 
 
 
REACH Pathways bridges the opportunity gap for under-resourced learners by combining game-based learning with AI-powered tools to build leadership and career skills. REACH provides learners with personalized support, financial resources, and a community that drives success in education and careers. 
View all 2024 Chicago Innovation Award Winners 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Chicago Innovation Awards Winners Reception
On January 21st, we celebrated Chicago's best and brightest at our Winners Reception, hosted by Vedder Price! With 421 organizations having won a Chicago Innovation Award since we began, we're reminded of just how powerful innovation is in shaping the Chicago region. From groundbreaking solutions to creative problem-solving, these winners are proof that our community thrives on fresh ideas. Cheers to 24 years of celebrating the innovators who continue to make Chicago a hub for creativity and progress.
 
 
 
 
Chicago Innovation Fellows Kicked off
On January 28th, we kicked off Chicago Innovation Fellows at Northwestern's Kellogg School of Management to support 11 Fellows in becoming world-class innovators. The day included Professor Tom Kuczmarski discussing "Innovation Best Practices," Professor Mohan Sawney teaching "Business Innovation," a panel discussion with Chicago Innovation Board Members Kevin Willer, Jai Shekhawat and Maria Wynne, and an inspiring talk over dinner with Chicago Innovation Award Winner and Board Member Pete Kadens.
 
 
We're Hiring: Chicago Innovation 
Summer Interns
Chicago Innovation is excited to announce we're recruiting for our Summer Internship Program starting in May or June 2025! This paid internship offers a unique opportunity to work alongside our team, play a key role in the Chicago Innovation Awards, support major events like the Climate Innovation Summit and Taste of Innovation, and contribute to initiatives that promote innovation for all.
Learn more here › 
 
 
Get Involved with the Illinois Student Invention Convention!
We’re seeking judges to evaluate students’ inventions virtually in March. It’s a fantastic way to witness creativity in action. 
Judging sign-ups are now open
, so register today to get involved.
 
 
 
Welcome New 2025 Chicago Innovation Sponsor 
 
 
 
 
August 5th, 2021 – John Rogers (Founder of Ariel Investments; Chicago business pioneer and philanthropist) addresses the crowd after being inducted into the Chicago Innovation Hall of Fame at the annual Chicago Innovation Foundation In-Gala at Ignite Glass Studios.
 
 
 
 
 
 
      
      
      
 
 
Chicago Innovation | 
2001 N Halsted
 Suite 201 | 
Chicago, IL 60614 US

subject: A Transform 2025 First: Exclusive Film Screening for Attendees
body:
Get a front-row seat and don’t miss this exclusive screening, meet the creators behind it, and hear how AI is reshaping leadership at Transform 2025.
 
Hi Hannah,
 
This week we're highlighting three must-see experiences happening each day of the conference, Monday, March 17th - Wednesday, March 19th, from an exclusive 
community screening of 
LILLY
 to deep conversations on the Main Stage about 
workplace equity
 and 
AI’s evolving role in leadership
. If you haven’t secured your spot yet, now’s the time to join us and be part of these powerful discussions.
 
Save Your Spot Now.
 
Sunday & Monday: Exclusive Film Screening - 
LILLY
 
Join the Transform 2025 Community and step into history with an 
exclusive private screening of 
LILLY
, the story of workplace equality icon Lilly Ledbetter, 
starring Golden Globe Winner/Academy Award nominee Patricia Clarkson.
 Her two-decade battle for fair pay led to a landmark law protecting workers' rights, and now her story is coming to the big screen. This is a rare opportunity to experience her journey up close, connect with fellow attendees, and reflect on the power of one voice to spark real change. Be part of a community that champions workplace equity! 
Join us at Transform 2025
.
Tuesday: Go Behind the Scenes
 
The conversation continues on Tuesday, March 18th on the Transform 2025 Main Stage as the people behind 
LILLY
 share how this powerful story came to life. Lilly’s daughter, 
Vickie Ledbetter Saxon
, along with Writer, Director, and Producer, 
Rachel Feldman
, and Co-Executive Producer 
Jenny Dearborn
, 
will share how one woman's journey from an Alabama tire factory worker became a catalyst for national change
.
 This can’t-miss discussion 
showcases Lilly's enduring legacy and the ongoing fight for equal pay, inspiring future generations of workplace equality advocates.
 
These are the conversations shaping the future of people + work. 
Check out the full event agenda
. 
Wednesday: Evolving AI - What You Need to Know
 
Generative AI is transforming the way we work, but what does that really mean for people leaders like you? In this Main Stage fireside chat, 
Tigran Sloyan
, CEO of CodeSignal, and 
Cassie Kozyrkov
, Google’s first Chief Decision Scientist, will break down how AI is reshaping leadership, skills, and the workforce. You will walk away with real insights on how to harness AI’s potential while keeping people at the heart of innovation because technology should work for us, not replace us.

subject: Reflecting on Our New Landscape
body:
Out & Equal’s February 2025 Newsletter
 
 
 
Reflecting on Our New Landscape
 
It has been about three weeks since a new administration came to power in the United States. In that short period of time, through executive orders and actions, political appointments, and rhetoric, we have seen an agenda centered on tactics—exclusion, othering, and fear—that run counter to the interests of individuals, businesses, and communities.
Throughout my career, from consultancy to my role as CEO of Out & Equal today, I’ve experienced the ebbs and flows of political, economic, and societal changes and their impacts on people, organizations, and everyday life. But through it all, here is what has always been constant: a desire to make us all stronger by expanding access to opportunity and leading with principles like inclusion and belonging.
We are in the midst of a concerted effort to roll back protections for the most marginalized and underserved, establish new norms that seek to further divide and isolate, and institutionalize disinformation.
At Out & Equal, our commitment to the Business of Belonging remains strong. We are:
Engaging with leaders:
 
Actively participating in coalition meetings and conducting strategic meetings with company CEOs and their top leadership to provide them support in their workforce and stakeholder responsiveness.
 
Integrating Virtual Workplace Summit learnings
: 
Incorporating the valuable lessons and community-building experiences from our recent Virtual Summit into our ongoing programs and initiatives.
 
Empowering Employee Resource Group (ERG) leaders
: 
Sharpening and expanding our resources and support materials specifically designed to equip and empower ERG leaders to effectively navigate and address these challenging times. 
 
Beyond, what our organizations can do, we all have an individual role to play. So, what can you do? To answer that question, we must look to our past in order to chart our path forward.
Now is the time to draw strength and inspiration from the pioneers and everyday heroes who came before us. As we celebrate, honor, and recognize Black History Month, I can’t help but think of individuals like Bayard Rustin, Marsha P. Johnson, Barbara Jordan, and so many more, who through immense challenge and struggle, kept pushing for justice and equality. And through those efforts, they not only advanced those causes for themselves and their communities but for us all.
It’s not lost on me that the immense progress we have made has been the result of the most marginalized and those under the greatest threat—transgender, nonbinary, and people of color—demanding and fighting for change. Individuals like Bayard, Marsha, and Barbara knew that one group’s loss of freedom, justice, equality, and dignity, impacted all of society.
In these next weeks, months, and years, we cannot tune out or disengage. We must stay active and connected. We must use our power and sphere of influence to hold ourselves, our friends and family, and our leaders accountable. So, stay informed. Engage in the hard conversations. Ensure your organizations continue to build inclusive and welcoming workplaces. Find community.
We must not and cannot stop fighting for the principles and ideals of equality, inclusion, and belonging for all.
Quite simply, it’s not only the right thing to do but it will make us all—our communities, our businesses, and our society—stronger.
I know that is what I and Out & Equal are committed to.
 
 
 
 
The LGBTQ+ Community is Not a Monolith: Celebrating & Honoring Black History Month
As our CEO, Erin Uritus, has stated, it’s critical we recognize the unique, and near insurmountable, challenges faced by Black Queer people in the workplace and beyond. Challenges like the systemic barriers that can block opportunity and equal justice. Challenges to being safe in one’s own community.
﻿
And despite the challenges, the risks, and the loss, trailblazers, icons, and everyday individuals have pushed forward to advance causes, communities, and movements. They have done this in the face of adversities that other people have not, do not, and will not face.
It’s a reminder of the immense resilience of this community. Organizations cannot and must not overlook the Black Queer community. They have shaped societies and culture as we know it, and their contributions will only continue to drive meaningful change that help organizations, communities, and society thrive.
Read More
 
 
 
Building Community Year-Round
 
Our Virtual Summit programming was just the beginning of what will be an impactful year of community and convening.
Out & Equal is heading across the US and the globe to engage with our Partners at roundtables, forums, and symposiums. In these convenings, we'll be discussing of-the-moment issues and helping Partners develop strategies to advance LGBTQ+ workplace equality, inclusion, and belonging through a regional and local lens.
Don't forget to register now for our Partner-exclusive events!
 
﻿
﻿
2025 London Symposium: Shaping the Future of LGBTQ+ Workplace Inclusion
Friday, February 28
London, England, UK
 
 
﻿
2025 Out & Equal Leadership Forum
Monday, March 17-Wednesday, March 19
Oxon Hill, Maryland, USA
Please be sure to reference the 
Out & Equal Events Calendar
, which is updated on a regular basis.
For any questions regarding our convenings and how to access them, please reach out to 
partnerships@outandequal.org
.
 
 
Register for the 2025 Out & Equal Leadership Forum
For more than 15 years, Out & Equal has convened more than 3,000 executives, ascending leaders, practitioners, and allies through a one-of-a-kind, Partner-exclusive gathering created to provide unique networking and timely learning opportunities.
 
 
Leadership Forum, taking place from 
March 17-19
, is a moment to break through the noise and focus on the insights, learnings, and connections that will deliver measurable and lasting progress for you, your teams, and your organization.
 
 
A curated agenda featuring highly customized program tracks will engage and empower change agents at all levels while clearly reinforcing the value of inclusion and belonging in driving key business strategies forward.
 
Register Now
 
 
 
We Need Your Insights and Experiences!
 
We know that ERGs play a vital role in advancing workplace inclusion and belonging. It's why 
Out & Equal is conducting a short survey, 
Meeting the Moment: Illuminating the Path Forward for Employee Resource Groups
,
 that we will use to inform future ERG-related programming, offerings, and content.
﻿We would love to know more about your experiences with your company or organization's LGBTQ+ Employee Resource Group, Business Resource Group, Affinity Group, or equivalent. We appreciate your contributions as we aim to produce relevant, cutting-edge content that helps to create environments where everyone can thrive.
Take the Survey
 
 
﻿
"At Out & Equal, we’re looking to expand our ERG suite of support to better serve ERG leaders, Executive Champions, and DEI staff. Our goal is to develop a broader and more holistic program that will improve program management, foster intersectional allyship, and create spaces for community-building and networking.
Your input will help us shape this expanded program by identifying challenges, opportunities, and areas for growth. ERGs are essential to fostering belonging, talent development, and retention, and we’re excited to build this program with your insights. Thank you for your support!" 
﻿
—
Erin Uritus
 (she/her), CEO of Out & Equal
 
 
 
The Out & Equal Virtual Workplace Summit: 
﻿
Three Days of Impactful & Inspiring Programming
Hurricane Milton forced a shift in circumstances for the in-person 2024 Out & Equal Workplace Summit, but it didn’t shift our commitment to progress. Following the difficult but necessary decision to cancel the in-person event, Out & Equal reimagined Summit and created brand new-content as part of a pivot to hybrid Summit programming with virtual and in-person elements spanning the end of 2024 and into the start of 2025.
 
Last month, members of the Out & Equal Partner came together for three days of powerful conversations, community-building and networking opportunities, and engaging sessions that left attendees with actionable insights and learnings to advance inclusion and belonging in their organizations.
﻿
Reminder! 
You can continue exploring Summit sessions and resources on-demand on the Out & Equal app and 
Virtual Platform
 through 
April 25, 2025
.
 
 
Welcome to our New Partners!
At Out & Equal, we work with the world's leading and most influential companies—and the inclusive leaders at these organizations—to advance LGBTQ+ inclusion and belonging in the workplace.  
 
We’re proud to welcome 
Brown & Brown
 and 
Valley National Bank
 
as our newest members of the Out & Equal Partner Community.
 
 
 
Partner in the Business of Belonging™
Through thought leadership and partnership (advisory services, knowledge, resources, and tools) and global programs and transformative events, becoming an Out & Equal Partner will supercharge your LGBTQ+ workplace inclusion progress.
We look forward to having you join us in the movement!
Learn More
 
 
FOLLOW US
  
  
  
  
 
 
outandequal.org
Out & Equal | 
1111 Broadway
 3rd Floor | 
Oakland, CA 94607 US

subject: Just Announced: US Chapters, 2025 Emcee, and Main Stage
body:
11 US Chapters launched! See who this year's Transform 2025 Emcee will be and what main stage session has just been added. Don't miss out on joining your peers for the best event of the year.
 
Hi Hannah,
 
This week brings news you don’t want to miss! We’ve officially launched 
US Chapters
, creating more ways for people-first leaders to connect and collaborate in their own cities. Plus, a valued member of our community has been chosen as this year’s Emcee. Can you guess who it is? And, a must-see main-stage conversation has been added to the agenda. Transform 2025 is coming fast. Be sure to secure your spot now and join people leaders from Atlassian, NASCAR, Ritual, SKIMS, and many more.
 
Save Your Spot Now.
 
 
Global to Local: Transform Chapters Are Taking Off in the US! 
Transform has always been a global movement, connecting people across more than 60 chapters worldwide. Now, we’re bringing that momentum to the US! 
After launching internationally, we're excited to announce 
Transform Chapters are now expanding across the US,
 creating a 
cohesive, connected global community
 where people-first leaders can make an impact 
both locally and globally. 
Starting the week of February 17th, we’re rolling out city-based hubs in 11 local chapters
 
led by incredible community changemakers 
shaping the future of people + work
. These cities are 
Atlanta, Chicago, Denver, Houston, Las Vegas, Los Angeles, New York, Philadelphia, Phoenix, San Francisco, and Seattle
.
 They will be creating action-driven spaces where authentic conversations lead to real change.

subject: Chicago Innovation Monthly – January Edition
body:
Join us for the first in-person event of the year!﻿
 
Kick off 2025 with us on February 26th as we convene top experts at the cutting edge of artificial intelligence. Listen, learn and network to discover the latest in AI: 
– Top AI trends for 2025
– How this evolving technology can advance you today
– What’s next: How AI will shape our lives in ways once unimaginable
Get tickets now
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
In its 1st cohort, Chicago Innovation Fellows is advancing tomorrow's innovation leaders today. Meet the Northwestern Kellogg faculty members who will be guiding our Fellows on their innovation journeys, along with many Chicago Innovation Award winners who will be speakers and coaches too.
 
 
 
Now in its 18th cohort, Chicago Innovation's Women's Mentoring Co-op is 
﻿where women innovate, connect and grow. 
 
 
 
 
Now in its 7th cohort, The Ladder supports Black and Latine professionals
in advancing their careers.
 
 
 
 
 
 
Now in its 13th cohort, Ageless Innovators fuels intergenerational collaboration through cross-generational mentorship. And our new Intergenerational Teams In Action initiative fosters more productive age-integrated workplaces.
 
 
 
 
 
Serving over 30,000 K-8th grade students, the Illinois Student Invention Convention continues its statewide expansion to educate, connect and celebrate student innovators.
 
 
1st issued patent,
10 more pending
4500 students
up from 2500
 
 
Chicago Innovation's Climate Change Initiative enters its fourth year of 
﻿convening and celebrating innovators combating climate change.
 
 
 
 
Chicago Innovation Monthly Poll
In what area do you think Chicago will see the most growth in innovation in 2025?
Sustainability & Green Innovation
 
Food Innovation
 
HealthTech
 
Cybersecurity
 
AI & Automation
 
FinTech
 
 
 
 
Team Updates: Exciting News at Chicago Innovation!
 
We’re thrilled to announce that Finn Bauer has been promoted to Chicago Innovation Fellows Program Manager and Membership Coordinator. Finn’s passion and dedication will continue to drive the success of the Chicago Innovation Fellows Program as we look ahead to an exciting 2025!
 
 
Meet Galyna Kravets, our new Graphic Designer. Galyna will be responsible for creating visually compelling materials that amplify our programs, events, and communications across multiple platforms.
 
 
Welcome New 2025 Chicago Innovation Sponsors
 
 
 
As we prepare for our first big event of the year – "AI + IQ" on February 26th – we think back to the first AI-focused event we hosted in March of 2017. Eight years ago, we spent a lot of time just trying to define artificial intelligence – and in a lot of ways, we're still trying to! But the discussion has expanded beyond our imaginations...
 
*From left to right, with titles as of 2017:
Mike Shelton, Technical Director Azure Data Services, Microsoft
Stephen Pratt, CEO, Noodle.ai
Kris Hammond, Co-founder, Narrative Science
Julie Friedman Steele, Chairman of the Board, World Future Society
Tom Kuczmarski, Co-founder, Chicago Innovation
Brenna Argall, Director - Rehabilitation Robotics Lab, Rehabilitation Institute of Chicago

body:
There are only 2 days left to save on your Transform 2025 ticket. Register before Friday, January 17th, to save over $1,000 on your ticket compared to buying it at the door.
 
Hi Hannah,
With just two months until Transform 2025, the countdown is on! Don’t miss your chance to save over $1,000 from the onsite price. Prices go up this Friday, January 17th, so 
lock in your lower price now
.
This year’s lineup is shaping up to be unforgettable. From inspiring main stage speakers to hands-on workshops, Transform is packed with opportunities to learn, connect, and grow. Plus, we’re bringing the energy to our After Party, and you'll be surrounded by people-first leaders from some of the most innovative companies in the world. Mark your calendar for March 17th - 19th, and grab your ticket now to be part of the magic!
 
 
We’re thrilled to announce that 
Ursula Burns
, the first African American woman to lead a Fortune 500 company, Xerox, 
and now Chairwoman of Teneo, 
and Brian Baker, Teneo’s first Chief People Officer, will take the main stage at Transform 2025! They will share how their partnership is redefining leadership and setting bold new standards for the future of work. 
Don’t miss this powerful conversation!

Get your dancing shoes and moves ready! After three days of making new connections and rekindling old ones, expanding your mind, and getting a year's worth of meetings accomplished, unwind with your peers to the undeniable beats of the legendary Timbaland!
