subject: Preparing for the Future
body:
Out & Equal’s January 2025 Newsletter
 
 
 
Preparing for the Future
As we start the New Year and prepare to see a new administration come to power in the United States, I’m thinking of these words from Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., 
“Change does not roll in on the wheels of inevitability but comes through continuous struggle. And so, we must straighten our backs and work for our freedom.”
  
  
I began my tenure as Out & Equal’s CEO on Martin Luther King Jr. Day in 2018. The crosscurrents of the day–service, solemnity for all of the lives lost in the pursuit of a more just future, and the hope of what organizations like Out & Equal inspire around the world–were pulsing through me as I got to work.  
 
Just weeks into my start, we witnessed the tragic shooting at Parkland High School. In the devastating aftermath, we saw the resilience of the human spirit and tragedy turn into action. From classrooms to board rooms, young high school organizers and CEOs declared, we must be better as a society. We must speak up like our lives and our children’s lives depend on it. 
 
When adversity is its most acute, when the stakes are high enough, real leaders emerge. It was in this moment in 2018 that a new voice grew. Companies and their leaders took stock of their own power and decided to speak up and leverage their spheres of influence for change. This was not politically motivated – or popular. It was both the right thing to do and smart business. The CEOs I admire most look beyond the immediate headlines and short-term trends to the long game of how inclusion is built, sustained, and translated into durable plans for the future–to cultures of 
belonging
.  
 
Around that time, Out and Equal pivoted into the Business of Belonging–our unique approach to holistic culture optimization that is focused on the unique strengths and challenges of LGBTQ+ professionals, as well as intersectional allyship across identities and experience. And maybe most important of all, we connected our Partners together in an active and engaged community of change practitioners. No one must reinvent the wheel or spend unnecessary time on a learning curve. We all help each other make talent attraction and retention as effective as it needs to be in a multi-cultural environment that is only getting more diverse, facing ever more complex business challenges.  
 
The year ahead won’t be easy. Undoubtedly, it will be filled with challenges and uncertainty, with LGBTQ+ rights and progress being questioned and attacked. But here is what I know to be true: through it all, our community will keep pushing forward.   
  
There is no other choice, and we know no other way. We've faced challenges before, and they have only strengthened our resolve. Through setback and celebration, adversity has fueled our movement for equality. And now, when there is so much at stake, it must also sharpen our focus and prompt our creativity. We are forged from fire, joy, pain and freedom. This is not just lip service to “resilience”–this will be resilience with purpose, a deep knowing of who we are and what we can do when we do it together.
 
 
 
Recognizing & Celebrating Mentorship Month
The start of a New Year, which aligns with 
Mentoring Month
,
 is an ideal time to think about how we can be more intentional, inclusive, and impactful in the work we do. Mentorship, sponsorship, and coaching all play an integral role in optimizing workplace cultures and creating opportunities for all individuals to thrive.
While the benefits of mentorship are immense to enhancing talent strategies, creating more inclusive cultures, and advancing key business objectives, in research conducted by Out & Equal, we found that 
only 10% of LGBTQ+ people
 report that their organizations have an LGBTQ+-specific mentorship program.
This year, leaders and organizations should take the opportunity to develop comprehensive mentorship programs that reach the entirety of their workforce.  
To get you and your organization started on this journey, Out & Equal has a resource outlining the differences between mentorship, sponsorship, and coaching, their value, and examples of how our Partners have implemented successful programs.
﻿
Read More
 
 
 
We Need Your Insights and Experiences!
 
We know that ERGs play a vital role in advancing workplace inclusion and belonging. It's why 
Out & Equal is conducting a short survey, 
Meeting the Moment: Illuminating the Path Forward for Employee Resource Groups
,
 that we will use to inform future ERG-related programming, offerings, and content.
﻿We would love to know more about your experiences with your company or organization's LGBTQ+ Employee Resource Group, Business Resource Group, Affinity Group, or equivalent. We appreciate your contributions as we aim to produce relevant, cutting-edge content that helps to create environments where everyone can thrive.
Take the Survey
 
 
﻿
"At Out & Equal, we’re looking to expand our ERG suite of support to better serve ERG leaders, Executive Champions, and DEI staff. Our goal is to develop a broader and more holistic program that will improve program management, foster intersectional allyship, and create spaces for community-building and networking.
Your input will help us shape this expanded program by identifying challenges, opportunities, and areas for growth. ERGs are essential to fostering belonging, talent development, and retention, and we’re excited to build this program with your insights. Thank you for your support!" 
﻿
—
Erin Uritus
 (she/her), CEO of Out & Equal
 
 
Start Your 2025 in Community with Out & Equal
Throughout the year, we’ll be heading across the US and the globe to engage with our Partners at roundtables, forums, and symposiums. In these convenings, we'll be discussing of-the-moment issues and helping Partners develop strategies to advance LGBTQ+ workplace equality, inclusion, and belonging through a regional and local lens.
In the next three months, we’ll be convening our community through the following Partner-exclusive events*:
*Availability based on capacity and Partnership tier.
﻿
 
﻿
Out & Equal Virtual Workplace Summit
Tuesday, January 14-Thursday, January 16
﻿
 
﻿
Seattle Community Networking & Learning Reception
Tuesday, January 28
Seattle, Washington, USA
Sponsored by:
 
 
﻿2025 Philippine LGBTQ+ Gender Spectrum Forum and Leadership Symposium
Tuesday, February 11
Manila, Philippines
Sponsored by:
 
 
﻿
2025 London Symposium: Shaping the Future of LGBTQ+ Workplace Inclusion
Friday, February 28
London, England, UK
Hosetd by:
 
Sponsored by:
 
 
﻿
2025 Out & Equal Leadership Forum
Monday, March 17-Wednesday, March 19
Oxon Hill, Maryland, USA
﻿In the coming weeks, we’ll be back with more information on Events extending beyond Q1. In the meantime, please be sure to reference the 
Out & Equal Events Calendar
, which is updated on a regular basis.
For any questions regarding our convenings and how to access them, please reach out to 
partnerships@outandequal.org
.
 
 
How Can You Advance the Business of Belonging in Your Organization? Register for the 2025 Out & Equal Leadership Forum
For more than 15 years, Out & Equal has convened more than 3,000 executives, ascending leaders, practitioners, and allies through a one-of-a-kind, Partner-exclusive gathering created to provide unique networking and timely learning opportunities.
 
 
Leadership Forum, taking place from March 17-19, is a moment to break through the noise and focus on the insights, learnings, and connections that will deliver measurable and lasting progress for you, your teams, and your organization.
 
 
A curated agenda featuring highly customized program tracks will engage and empower change agents at all levels while clearly reinforcing the value of inclusion and belonging in driving key business strategies forward.
Register Now
 
 
 
Out & Equal is Your Strategic Thought Partner 365-24-7
A new year comes with new opportunities and new challenges, and as we navigate a new and complex landscape, Out & Equal is: 
Meeting our Partners where they are on their inclusion journey, tailoring solutions to their organization’s unique needs.
Providing our Partners exclusive access to best-in-class global learning and development programming, expert consulting and advisory services opportunities, transformative convening events, and seminal thought leadership.
A trusted confidante and advisor with robust experience successfully, confidently, and confidentially helping Partners navigate whatever shifting sociopolitical landscapes they face. 
 
Learn more about our impact in 2024 and consider joining our community in the year ahead.  
Read Our 2024 Impact Report
 
 
 
Join the Out & Equal Community
 
Through thought leadership and partnership (advisory services, knowledge, resources, and tools) and global programs and transformative events, becoming an Out & Equal Partner will supercharge your LGBTQ+ workplace inclusion progress. 
We look forward to having you join us in the movement! 
Partner in the Business of Belonging™
Learn More
 
 
FOLLOW US
  
  
  
  
 
 
outandequal.org
Out & Equal | 
1111 Broadway
 3rd Floor | 
Oakland, CA 94607 US

subject: Looking Ahead to 2025 and Beyond
body:
Out & Equal’s December 2024 Newsletter
 
 
 
Looking Ahead to 2025 and Beyond
  
Nearly 30 years ago, we proudly declared that no one should have to choose between being out and being equal, especially in a place where we spend much of our lives: work.
  
Back then, it was a radical idea. But by partnering with hundreds of businesses, uniting thousands of allies and community members globally, and strategically connecting belonging to business results, Out & Equal has made this once radical idea a reality for many.
And even in this challenging moment, we are determined to make it a reality for all. In 2025, we’re doubling down on our efforts—and our impact.
Let’s not forget that our fight for full inclusion and belonging was born out of adversity—when our love, our families, and our right to work authentically and free from discrimination were not protected by the law.
Adversity has always been the spark, but it’s our determination and bold imagination that continue to fuel a more inclusive version of the world.
We have been tested before and emerged stronger. We will do it again.
 
 
 
Thank You to Our Partners
 
 
 
 
Standing With Our Partners 365-24-7
Throughout 2024, Out & Equal supported its Partners in in optimizing their talent recruitment, retention, and leadership development strategies.
﻿
Read the 2024 Out & Equal Impact Report 
Despite what the headlines may read, our work continued to cut through the noise. Today, the Out & Equal Partner community:
 
Is now 330+ strong and growing.
Includes 75+ new Partners.
Includes global companies from across the Fortune 500 in every major sector and industry.
 
In 2025 and beyond, we will continue to:
Meet our Partners where they are on their inclusion journey, tailoring solutions to their organization’s unique needs.
Provide our Partners exclusive access to best-in-class global learning and development programming, expert consulting and advisory services opportunities, transformative convening events, and seminal thought leadership.
Be a trusted confidante and advisor with robust experience successfully, confidently, and confidentially helping Partners navigate whatever shifting sociopolitical landscapes they face.
 
 
Registration is now open for the 
﻿
2025 Leadership Forum
Join Out & Equal in Oxon Hill, MD, located right outside of Washington, D.C. as we host our annual Partner-exclusive 
Leadership Forum
 from Monday, March 17 to Wednesday, March 19.
﻿
Invitations were sent via email this morning, so please check your inboxes if you are a main point of contact. Confirmation of registration for Leadership Forum is required, and space is limited, so we encourage you to register as soon as possible!
For any questions regarding registration, please reach out to 
registration@outandequal.org
. 
 
 
Join the Out & Equal Community
 
Through thought leadership and partnership (advisory services, knowledge, resources, and tools) and global programs and transformative events, becoming an Out & Equal Partner will supercharge your LGBTQ+ workplace inclusion progress. 
We look forward to having you join us in the movement! 
Partner in the Business of Belonging™
Learn More
 
 
FOLLOW US
  
  
  
  
 
 
outandequal.org
Out & Equal | 
1111 Broadway
 3rd Floor | 
Oakland, CA 94607 US
Unsubscribe
 | 
Update Profile
 |

body:
traditional training methods often fall short of preparing employees for real-world challenges.

The Power of Practice: Redefining Skill Development with Experiential Learning
Thursday, Dec 12, 2024
VIRTUAL • INTERACTIVE • NO COST
In today’s fast-paced digital world, traditional training methods often fall short of preparing employees for real-world challenges. What’s the solution? 
Experiential learning.
 
Join us for an insightful presentation that redefines skill development by focusing on ‘learning by doing.’ Discover how providing a safe and practical environment for employees to practice and experiment can unlock their full potential while reinforcing critical knowledge through hands-on experiences.
REGISTER TODAY & EARN PDC CREDITS

Shift from theory to practice to enable deeper skill development.
Implement actionable strategies for effective experiential learning.
Use simulation software to create a safe, hands-on training environment.

subject: Help innovate the future of the Great Lakes with us this Friday morning
body:
Next Topic: 
Fueling growth, opportunity and innovation with Great Lakes water resources
 
Dear Ashton,
Innovation In Action is a concerted effort to convene the region's innovators to ideate against the city's biggest challenges. This next session on Friday, December 6th is done in partnership with Current and focused on 
fueling growth, opportunity and innovation with Great Lakes water resources.
 
In 2024, Current was awarded one of just ten National Science Foundation-supported Regional Innovation Engines. 
Great Lakes ReNEW
 is an up to 10-year, $160M investment in building a Great Lakes blue economy and boosting regional water innovation leadership. We are inviting YOU to help the team shape future strategies for this work.
Virtual Ideation Session:
Friday, December 6th 9:30-11:30am CT
 
 
9:30am-9:45am: 
Defining the challenges
﻿9:45am-11:30am: 
Multiple rounds of interactive breakout groups for participants to ideate solutions
 
If you possess an innovation mindset and a love for Chicago, 
﻿we want you involved!﻿
 
 
 
Chicago Innovation | 
2001 N Halsted
 Suite 201 | 
Chicago, IL 60614 US

subject: Register for the next virtual Innovation In Action session on December 6th
body:
Next Topic: 
Fueling growth, opportunity and innovation with Great Lakes water resources
 
Dear Ashton,
Innovation In Action is a concerted effort to convene the region's innovators to ideate against the city's biggest challenges. This next session on December 6th is done in partnership with Current and focused on 
fueling growth, opportunity and innovation with Great Lakes water resources.
 
In 2024, Current was awarded one of just ten National Science Foundation-supported Regional Innovation Engines. 
Great Lakes ReNEW
 is an up to 10-year, $160M investment in building a Great Lakes blue economy and boosting regional water innovation leadership. We are inviting YOU to help the team shape future strategies for this work.
Virtual Ideation Session:
Friday, December 6th 9:30-11:30am CT
 
 
9:30am-9:45am: 
Defining the challenges
﻿9:45am-11:30am: 
Multiple rounds of interactive breakout groups for participants to ideate solutions
 
If you possess an innovation mindset and a love for Chicago, 
﻿we want you involved!﻿
 
 
 
Chicago Innovation | 
2001 N Halsted
 Suite 201 | 
Chicago, IL 60614 US

subject: Recap of the 23rd annual Chicago Innovation Awards
body:
Hello Ashton,
 
What a night!  As we reflect on the 23rd annual Chicago Innovation Awards from last Thursday, here's what made it so momentous: 
- Having a packed house of 650 people at the UIC Forum
- Opening the show "Olympics-Style" with a 60-person marching band, breakdancers and so much more
- And of course, 
22 incredible Chicago Innovation Award winners!
Read below to discover this year's winners and more that showcases the power of Chicago's innovation community!

subject: 🚨Last Week to Nominate: Talent Trailblazers Awards Program
body:
Dear AshtonJust one week remains to nominate outstanding individuals for Chief Talent Officer's inaugural awards program – The Talent Trailblazers!
 
Dear Ashton
 
Just one week remains to nominate outstanding individuals for Chief Talent Officer's inaugural awards program – The Talent Trailblazers!
 
Nomination Deadline: November 21
 
The Talent Trailblazers awards program aims to spotlight emerging leaders in talent management and HR who are making a notable impact on their organizations and teams.
 
Why Nominate?
Celebration of Innovation:
 Acknowledge the industry's rising stars for their innovative contributions.
Professional Recognition: 
Showcase the achievements of up-and-coming professionals in talent management.
Virtual Awards Reception: 
Winners will be announced and celebrated during a virtual awards reception in early 2025.
 
We appreciate your commitment to promoting excellence in the field of HR and talent management. Don't miss this opportunity to recognize the best and brightest talent in HR as they pave the way for innovation and positive change.
 
If you have any questions or need assistance, please feel free to reach out to Ave Rio, Chief Talent Officer’s managing editor, at ave@betterworkmedia.com.
 
We look forward to reading your application!
 
Chief Talent Officer

body:
Hi Hannah,
I hope all is well! I thought your work would be perfect for our 
L&D Program of the Year Award
 - one of the categories in our annual Transform Awards program.
The Transform Awards program was designed to recognize the most innovative organizations, people initiatives, and leaders of the year - you can check out the 
full list of awards available here
.
While there are a few types of Awards you can apply for, the L&D Program category celebrates the company with the most forward-thinking approach to building an incredible employee experience to attract, retain, and grow their people.

.

subject: Committed to Community, Belonging, and the Way Forward
body:
Out & Equal’s November 2024 Newsletter
 
 
 
Committed to Community, Belonging, and the Way Forward
 
Election Day is here. I proudly voted and I sincerely hope everyone with the ability to has or will cast their ballots for our country and for our future. 
 
The stakes are so high for the LGBTQ+ community and for equality-at-large.
 
As we await the results, know this. Regardless of the outcome of this election, the strength and power of the LGBTQ+ community will not change and our mission at Out & Equal will not change. We will remain focused on building businesses of belonging.
 
We will sharpen and hone our services to ensure your internal change agents, who are charged with doing this critical work in an ever-more complicated landscape, will have the tools and resources they need. We will continue to be a resource for leaders and a convener of community.
 
No matter what, we will keep pushing forward.
 
 
 
Reimagining Workplace Summit
 
Last month, in response to Hurricane Milton, we made the difficult but necessary decision to cancel the in-person component of this year’s Workplace Summit in Orlando, Florida.
We know how much this event means to our community, and we too, felt the disappointment of not being able to come together in-person.
While we were unable to convene, we did have an opportunity to capture powerful speeches from our Board Chair, Allyn L. Shaw (he/him), and our CEO, Erin Uritus (she/her).
In a moment of uncertainty, their remarks reinforce our community’s ability to meet any moment and persevere.
 
 
 
This content is only the beginning. As delivered in a call last week to our Partner community, Out & Equal has rolled out an exciting pivot to a “Virtual Summit” that lifts up curated premier sessions, fireside chats, and new resources from what would have taken place in Orlando.
We have already convened hundreds of Summit attendees in a series of “Illuminate Belonging” sessions and we are hosting our fifteen Community Engagement Groups (CEGs) that are bringing together LGBTQ+ professionals and allies from across our more than 330 Partner network between now and January.
﻿
Then, in a capstone moment during the week of January 13th, Out & Equal will convene the entire Workplace Summit attendee community (5,000+) over two days for exciting live learning, discussions, and community engagement. Most importantly, if you are an employee at an Out & Equal Partner company and were not slotted to attend Summit, Out & Equal is creating learning and discussion guides that will support your representatives in bringing back this learning to you in new and exciting Employee Resource Group (ERG) programming.
We're excited for what's in store and are confident this learning content will help our Partners advance inclusion and belonging in their workplace. 
 
 
 
On Transgender Day of Remembrance, we acknowledge and remember the lives of transgender individuals who have been tragically lost due to violence and discrimination.
  
And while we mourn those who are no longer with us, we must also recognize the strength and resilience of the transgender community, which in the face of immense adversity and danger, continues to be on the front lines of advancing equality for all.
﻿
This day is a poignant reminder that we all play a role in building a future where every individual, regardless of gender identity, can live freely without fear and thrive.
 
 
Out & Equal in the News
Our CEO, Erin Uritus: 
Penned an op-ed with Bob Witeck, President of Witeck Communications, Inc., for 
Fast Company
 on why inclusion and belonging, from talent to brand loyalty and the bottom line, remain business imperatives. 
 
Wrote a byline for 
The Advocate
 on National Coming Out Day about her own journey and how corporate leaders can ensure their building spaces of belonging where their LGBTQ+ employees can thrive. 
 
Jean-Marie Navetta (she/ella), Out & Equal’s Vice President of Learning Programs, was featured along several other luminaries and influencers in OUT’s “
Coming Out, Me
” series.  
 
 
Support Out & Equal on Giving Tuesday 
December 3
Everyone should be able to show up to work as their complete and authentic self. On Tuesday, December 3, Giving Tuesday, donate to Out & Equal.
﻿Your contribution makes a difference in advancing LGBTQ+ workplace inclusion and belonging. Together, we'll advance your business forward and build a future where everyone can thrive.
Donate Now!
 
 
 
Join the Out & Equal Community
 
Through thought leadership and partnership (advisory services, knowledge, resources, and tools) and global programs and transformative events, becoming an Out & Equal Partner will supercharge your LGBTQ+ workplace inclusion progress. 
We look forward to having you join us in the movement! 
Partner in the Business of Belonging™
Learn More
 
 
FOLLOW US
  
  
  
  
 
 
outandequal.org
Out & Equal | 
1111 Broadway
 3rd Floor | 
Oakland, CA 94607 US

subject: Chicago Innovation Monthly – October Edition
body:
Join Chicago’s Largest Celebration of Innovation!
The power of innovation unites us, and on November 14th you can be part of the Chicago region's biggest annual celebration of groundbreaking ideas at the UIC Forum. Discover the most innovative products and services across diverse industries, and connect with 700+ influential leaders from corporations, startups, non-profits, government, and the investment community. Don’t miss this incredible night to celebrate Chicago’s vibrant innovation community and honor the visionaries shaping the future!
﻿
Attend the Chicago Innovation Awards!
 
 
Get to Know the 
Judges 
﻿of the Chicago Innovation Awards!
 
 
View Their Bios Here
 
 
2024 Chicago Innovation All-Stars: 
Stats and Standouts
 From This Year's Nominees!
Need another reason to attend the 
Chicago Innovation Awards? 
Check out these stats from this year's nominees:
 
Impact Statistics of 
All Chicago Innovation Award Winners...
 
Measuring Success and Influence:
 
Unlock Insights: Explore Our 
Chicago 
ON
 Innovation
 
﻿Learning Archive with Videos of Past Winners
 
Jon Morris
, Founder of 
Rise Interactive
 
won a Chicago Innovation Award for its Interactive Investment Management (IIM) approach, which enables marketers to optimize budgets in real time for maximum impact.
 
Rahier Rahman
, Founder of 
Pangea
 won a Chicago Innovation Award 
created a simple, secure way to send money to Mexico for just $3.95, with cash pickup at over 10,000 locations or direct deposit to any Mexican bank account.
 
Eileen Murphy
,
 
Founder of 
ThinkCERCA
 and Chicago Innovation Award winner, developed an education technology platform that helps students in grades 4-12 build critical thinking skills through interactive, research-based lessons, now used by thousands of teachers and students nationwide.
 
Mike Shannon
, 
Founder of 
Packback
 and Chicago Innovation Award winner, created the first on-demand, One-Day eTextbook rental service, allowing students to rent textbooks as needed for $5 or less per day, providing an affordable solution in response to soaring textbook prices.
 
Nominee Trends and Analysis by 
Chicago Innovation
 Summer Interns

"
This year’s Chicago Innovation Award Nominees are energized to solve problems that they care deeply about, which is energizing to learn from....
"
Read the Article Here

"The annual Chicago Innovation Awards bring some of the region's most 
exciting ventures..."
Read the Article Here
 
 
 
 
Throwback to the 
2024 Chicago Nominee Celebration!
 From the Archives, take a look back at the memorable moments and inspiring innovators that made this event special. 
Check out all the photos from the evening!
 
 
 
 
The Thrilling TechRise Season 4 Finale!
﻿The TechRise Season 4 Finale is happening Thursday, November 21st, at Morgan Manufacturing. Six of 2024’s most innovative startups will pitch their ideas for a chance to win $100,000 in non-dilutive funding. This is your opportunity to witness groundbreaking pitches, network with industry leaders, and be part of a night that celebrates innovation and entrepreneurship.
Don’t miss out—grab your tickets today to experience the future of tech!

Entering is fast, easy, and free!

subject: Talent Trailblazers 2024: Nominations Extended to Nov. 21
body:
Chief Talent Officert's annual Talent Trailblazers awards program is back, and we're extending the nomination deadline to Nov. 21!
 
Unleashing Tomorrow’s Talent Leaders
 
Chief Talent Officert's annual Talent Trailblazers awards program is back, and we're extending the nomination deadline to Nov. 21! This celebrated initiative continues to recognize up-and-coming leaders in the talent management and HR profession.
 
In our rapidly evolving world, it's more crucial than ever to prioritize employee engagement and foster a sense of belonging and purpose within our organizations. Talent Trailblazers shines a spotlight on those emerging leaders who are driving this positive change.
 
Help us celebrate the best and brightest in our field at our virtual awards reception in early 2025. For comprehensive information on the nomination and selection process, visit 
https://talenttrailblazers.chieftalentofficer.co/2024-awards
.
 
Have questions? Reach out directly to Ave Rio, Talent Management's managing editor.
 
Don't miss this opportunity to nominate outstanding emerging leaders. Mark your calendars for November 21 and submit your nominations now!
REGISTER NOW
 
 
Ave Rio
MANAGING EDITOR, BetterWork Media Group
 
www.betterworkmedia.com/
 ave@betterworkmedia.com
 1 E. Erie Street, Suite 525, Unit 2025, Chicago, Illinois  60611

subject: One day left to apply to the Women's Mentoring Co-op
body:
﻿Or do you know someone who is?
Then we invite you to join the Women’s Mentoring Co-op!
1,100
 women have participated to date
APPLY TODAY
 
Dear Ashton,
There is only one day left to apply to 
Cohort 18
 of the Women’s Mentoring Co-op!
Join this community of visionary innovators and take your career to the next level. This is your chance to gain personalized, one-on-one mentorship while unlocking new skills and opportunities that will empower your professional journey.
Through the Women’s Mentoring Co-op, you’ll not only work closely with a mentor but also participate in exclusive events designed to boost your network, confidence, and personal brand. Whether you're aiming for a promotion, transitioning into leadership, or looking to sharpen your entrepreneurial edge, this is the program to help you get there.
Apply now or share this opportunity with a woman ready to make bold moves! 
Applications close on October 18th
. Don't miss out—be part of the next generation of innovators and leaders.
 
 
 
Top 4 reasons to apply
Gain a mentor
 who is intentionally chosen to help you achieve your goals
 
Access to exclusive 
Professional Development Workshops
 designed to help participants reach their goals
 
Join a community of 1,100 women 
innovators in the Chicagoland area
 
Tickets to Chicago Innovation events while you're in the cohort
 
APPLY TO BE A MENTEE TODAY!
 
 
Impact
 
 
 
95%
of mentees are closer to reaching their goals 
﻿
since starting the program
 
 
 
"I have more clarity on where I’d like to steer in my career path."
﻿
~ Past Mentee

﻿
~ Past Mentee

subject: [TOMORROW] Transform Learning: Free AI Webinar Now!
body:
In today’s rapidly evolving business world, adaptability is more than just a buzzword—it’s a necessity.
View in browser
 
 
REGISTER TODAY & EARN PDC CREDITS
 
AI and Scenario-Based Learning: Upskilling for Workforce Adaptability
Wednesday, Oct 16, 2024
VIRTUAL • INTERACTIVE • NO COST
In today’s rapidly evolving business world, adaptability is more than just a buzzword—it’s a necessity. That’s why we’re excited to invite you to our upcoming webinar, 
“AI and Scenario-Based Learning: Upskilling for Workforce Adaptability.”
 
REGISTER TODAY & EARN PDC CREDITS
 
🚀 
What You’ll Discover:
AI in action:
 See how AI-powered tools are creating personalized, engaging learning experiences that help employees stay ahead of technological changes and evolving job demands.
Scenario-based learning:
 Dive into immersive scenarios that develop critical thinking, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
Practical strategies:
 Learn how to integrate AI into your learning programs to enhance knowledge retention, skill application, and overall performance.
Join us for an insightful session with 
Molly Gonzales
, our 
Expert in Educational Programs Development
 from the University of Phoenix, as she shares how AI and scenario-based learning can revolutionize your workforce development.

subject: Last week to register for Uniting Generations on 10/23 at the Black Ensemble Theater
body:
Dear Ashton,
We are excited to invite you to a vibrant celebration and conversation featuring the winners of the 3rd annual Turn the Page on Age Awards!
- Be inspired by people who are redefining the topic of aging
- Join a discussion about the power of intergenerational relationship-building
- Meet change-makers who defy traditional stereotypes and embrace life with passion, purpose, and innovation 
Whether you're 20 years old, 100 years old, or anything in between, we hope to see you for this uniquely uplifting evening.
Best, 
Luke Tanen, President and CEO, Chicago Innovation
Tom Kuczmarski, Co-founder, Chicago Innovation
Niki Fox, Executive Director, The Village Chicago
 
 
 
 
People and organizations that are combating ageism through bold achievements and dynamic reinvention
MODERATOR 
 
Mary O'Donnell
CEO, RRF Foundation for Aging
 | One of the nation's largest grant-makers that supports older adults.
2024 Turn the Page on Age Honoree
 
Marc Freedman
Founder and Co-CEO, CoGenerate
 | 
The Wall Street Journal named his most recent book —
 
How to Live Forever: The Enduring Power of Connecting the Generations
 — one of the year’s best books on aging well. 
 
2024 Turn the Page on Age Honoree
 
Emilia DiMenco
President and CEO, Women's Business Development Center |
 Presides over the largest, oldest and most comprehensive women’s business assistance center in the U.S.
2024 Turn the Page on Age Honoree
 
Don Bell
Founding Chairperson, Illinois Commission on LGBTQ+ Aging; Board Member, The Village Chicago
 |
 Challenges ageism and ableism in intersection with other forms of social marginalization as they impact the aging community.
 
Agenda
5pm-6pm: Cocktail reception
6pm-7pm: Awards and panel discussion
7pm-7:30pm: Post event networking
 
 
Black Ensemble Theater 
4450 N Clark St
Complimentary drinks and light appetizers will be served. 
 
 
 
 
The Turn the Page on Age Awards is operated by the Chicago Innovation Foundation and The Village Chicago, and funded by RRF Foundation for Aging.
 
 
Chicago Innovation | 
2001 N Halsted
 Suite 201 | 
Chicago, IL 60614 US

subject: Cast your vote for the 2024 Chicago Innovation Awards "People's Choice Award" winner
body:
Ashton,
The Top 100 Finalists for the 2024 Chicago Innovation Awards have been chosen by our judges from the 350 nominees in the running. 
And we are asking YOU to be the judge
 by taking a look at these Finalists and voting for the winner of the annual People's Choice Award! 
The Top 100 Finalists cut across all industries, large corporations and startups, for-profits and non-profits, high tech, low tech and no tech. They reflect the breadth of innovation in the Chicago region.
The People's Choice Award winner, along with the other 20 winners as selected by our panel of judges, will be 
celebrated at the Chicago Innovation Awards on November 14th
 at UIC Forum.
 
 
Registration for the Chicago Innovation Awards ceremony on November 14th is now open -- vote, then register, below!

 Suite 201 | 
Chicago, IL 60614 US

subject: Claim Your Spot in HR's Hall of Fame Today!
body:
Talent Trailblazers celebrate the rising stars shaping the future of HR and talent management.
 
Unleashing Tomorrow’s Talent Leaders
 
Talent Trailblazers
 celebrate the rising stars shaping the future of HR and talent management. These high-potential emerging leaders are driving innovation, culture, and impact within their organizations. Gold, silver, and bronze awards are given across multiple categories, with one standout nominee being honored with the prestigious 
Trailblazer of the Year Award
.
Award Categories
 include:
 
✨ 
Trailblazer of the Year
: Recognizing an emerging leader whose strategic vision and measurable success have made them a true trailblazer in the field.
 
✨ 
Assessment & Measurement Trailblazers
: Celebrating leaders who have implemented powerful measurement systems to showcase the business impact of talent development programs.
 
✨ 
Culture Trailblazers
: Honoring leaders who have driven positive change through diversity initiatives, employee engagement, mental health support, and work-life balance.
 
✨ 
Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging Trailblazers
: Awarding leaders dedicated to creating inclusive environments and advancing DEIB initiatives within their organizations.
 
✨ 
Performance Management Trailblazers
: Recognizing those who have revolutionized performance management through innovative programs and behavioral assessments.
 
✨ 
Talent Acquisition Trailblazers
: Highlighting leaders shaping the future of recruitment, onboarding, and succession planning.
 
✨ 
Technology Innovation Trailblazers
: Celebrating pioneers who have harnessed emerging technology to foster employee collaboration and connection.
 
Be part of this year’s 
Talent Trailblazers
 and witness the next generation of HR innovators making a real difference in their organizations!
REGISTER NOW

subject: Discover Key Workforce Trends: 2025 Global Insights Report Released
body:
Access key trends from our 2025 Global Report—and act now before ticket prices go up this Friday, October 11th.   
 
Hi Hannah,
The Transform Global Insights 2025: The Now and Next of Work Report,
 sponsored by Deloitte, is now available! Discover insights from over 800 global companies on how organizations are prioritizing programs and technology investments across workforce wellbeing, global talent, DEI, and AI.
 
Did you know...
65% of global HR leaders are prioritizing 
Diverse Hiring Practices
78% of executives consider 
Career Development 
a priority
75% of leaders consider 
Employee Retention
 the most critical driver of business success
Want to learn more about what global companies are investing in? Simply 
participate in the short survey
 and you will receive the full report via email.
 
If you participated in the survey, you already have access to the report! Check your inbox for an email from 
insights@transform.us
 to download the full report. 
 
Transforming People + Work, Together!
Connect, learn, and grow all year with Transform. 
Secure your ticket
 to attend the premier three-day event in March and enjoy a complimentary one-year Transform Pro membership. This membership includes access to our online community platform, all Transform sessions on replay, year-round events, resources, and unlimited networking opportunities.
Prices go up this Friday, October 11th
. Tickets are cancelable and transferable, so there's 
no risk 
in
 locking in your spot at the lower rate now. 
Plus, as a Transform newsletter subscriber, you qualify for 
a special rate of $1,295
 (a savings of $1,500 from the onsite price)!
Bring Your Team
Attending Transform as a team 
strengthens your relationships and allows you to collectively benefit from the shared learning and experiences! 
Submit an inquiry here
 for more information on special Transform team pricing, benefits, and dedicated space for your group
.
Thank You to Our Sponsors
Transform 2025 would not be possible without the generous support of our sponsoring companies. 
A special thank you to our 
Title Sponsors: AceUp, Rippling, Sequoia, Sparrow, and Transcarent.
 
View all Sponsors
.

here
 
for additional details.
 
We look forward to welcoming you to

subject: Join us at Uniting Generations on October 23rd at the Black Ensemble Theater
body:
Dear Ashton,
We are excited to invite you to a vibrant celebration honoring the winners of the third annual Turn the Page on Age Awards!
- Be inspired by people who are redefining the topic of aging
- Join a discussion about the power of intergenerational relationship-building
- Meet change-makers who defy traditional stereotypes and embrace life with passion, purpose, and innovation 
Whether you're 20 years old, 100 years old, or anything in between, we hope to see you for this uniquely uplifting evening.
Best, 
Luke Tanen, President and CEO, Chicago Innovation
Tom Kuczmarski, Co-founder, Chicago Innovation
Niki Fox, Executive Director, The Village Chicago
 
 
 
 
People and organizations that are combating ageism through bold achievements and dynamic reinvention
MODERATOR 
 
Mary O'Donnell
CEO, RRF Foundation for Aging
 | One of the nation's largest grant-makers that supports older adults.
2024 Turn the Page on Age Honoree
 
Marc Freedman
Founder and Co-CEO, CoGenerate
 | 
The Wall Street Journal named his most recent book —
 
How to Live Forever: The Enduring Power of Connecting the Generations
 — one of the year’s best books on aging well. 
 
2024 Turn the Page on Age Honoree
 
Emilia DiMenco
President and CEO, Women's Business Development Center |
 Presides over the largest, oldest and most comprehensive women’s business assistance center in the U.S.
2024 Turn the Page on Age Honoree
 
Don Bell
Founding Chairperson, Illinois Commission on LGBTQ+ Aging; Board Member, The Village Chicago
 |
 Challenges ageism and ableism in intersection with other forms of social marginalization as they impact the aging community.
 
Agenda
5pm-6pm: Cocktail reception
6pm-7pm: Awards and panel discussion
7pm-7:30pm: Post event networking
 
 
Black Ensemble Theater 
4450 N Clark St
Complimentary drinks and light appetizers will be served. 
 
 
 
 
The Turn the Page on Age Awards is operated by the Chicago Innovation Foundation and The Village Chicago, and funded by RRF Foundation for Aging.
 
 
Chicago Innovation | 
2001 N Halsted
 Suite 201 | 
Chicago, IL 60614 US

subject: Reflecting on Our Past and Building Towards Our Future
body:
Out & Equal’s October 2024 Newsletter
 
 
 
Reflecting on Our Past and Building Towards Our Future
The journey towards LGBTQ+ justice, equality, and inclusion, has never been easy. We’ve faced countless challenges, naysayers, and setbacks. But, with the support of our allies, we’ve persevered.
Over the last two decades, we’ve achieved what once seemed impossible: workplace protections, marriage equality, greater representation across every major platform, and a shift in hearts and minds towards greater acceptance and inclusion of our community.
As we celebrate LGBTQ+ History Month, it’s important we remember our progress and our accomplishments. They remind us how strong our community can be and renew us for the important work ahead.
Today, extremists are (still) pushing for anti-LGBTQ+ legislation. A handful of companies have made short-sighted decisions to pull back on diversity, equity, and inclusion. But here’s what I know: The future is ours.
With each generation, our workforce and our society are becoming more Queer. One in five Gen Z adults identifies as LGBTQ+. We’re flexing our economic muscle, with LGBTQ+ purchasing power in the US estimated at $1.4 trillion. And our workplaces are becoming more inclusive, with 91% of Fortune 500 companies prohibiting workplace discrimination based on sexual orientation.
The winds of progress remain at our back. Let’s always remember that together, we’re powerful. Together, we can build a future centered on inclusion and belonging. Together, no one can stop us.  
 
 
 
Today, we are launching the official Out & Equal CEO Instagram account. 
﻿
Be sure to follow Erin Uritus 
@ceo_outandequal
 for her reflections on the moment we're in, the work and impact of Out & Equal, and how together, we will keeping push forward.
 
 
Throughout the month of October, we’re proud to celebrate and acknowledge the following:
 
LGBTQ+ History Month (October)
The history of the LGBTQ+ community is rich with joy and grief. Through the ups and downs, the history-making victories and the challenges that tested our resolve, our collective community has become stronger, showing that we are an unstoppable force. This month, we honor the trailblazers, activists, leaders, and everyday heroes who have paved the way for LGBTQ+ rights and equality.
International Lesbian Day (October 8)
We are proud to celebrate the lesbian community and its strength, diversity, and beauty. Today and every day, we acknowledge the integral role it has, is, and will continue to play in advancing LGBTQ+ equality.
 
National Coming Out Day (October 11)
Whether you are out and proud or your journey is just beginning, know that you are loved, seen, and valid. To those who are navigating their journey and determining how to share their stories at work, we encourage you to read our resource, 
Your Story. Your Truth. Your Power
.
International Pronouns Day (October 16)
Using someone’s correct pronouns is a simple and important way to show respect and affirm and validate someone’s identity. For tips on pronoun inclusion in the workplace, 
read this resource from Out & Equal
.
Spirit Day (October 17)
Stand up, stand for, and stand with LGBTQ+ youth by going purple for Spirit Day! While more young people are identifying as LGBTQ+, they still face adversity and hardship On Spirit Day and year-round, we must show our support for LGBTQ+ youth and take a stand against bullying in all of its forms.
Asexual Awareness Week (October 22-28)
For too long, the asexual community has experienced a lack of representation while being subjected to micro-agressions and questions and comments that invalidate and isolate. That must end. This week and beyond, let’s celebrate, elevate, and recognize the asexual community. Let’s take time to educate ourselves about their experiences and become allies in community.
Intersex Awareness Day (October 26)
Did you know that the global population of people who are intersex is larger than the entire nation of Japan? Despite the prevalence of intersex variation, too few employers have resources to understand the “I” in LGBTQI inclusion. It’s why we partnered with interACT Advocates for Youth to release a 
guide on supporting intersex inclusion in the workplace
.
﻿
 
﻿
At Out & Equal, we understand the importance of bringing your true and authentic self to all aspects of your life.
It's why we are and always will be committed to...  
Radiating Pride and Queer joy.  
Creating inclusive environments where 
all
 individuals can thrive. 
 
And advancing LGBTQ+ inclusion and belonging in the workplace and beyond.  
Whether you’re out and proud or your journey is just beginning, know that we stand with you. You are valid. You are seen.
 
Always embrace and celebrate who you are. Never forget that your truth is your power. And always remember—you are never alone on this journey.
On October 11, upload a brief message to your social channels, tag Out & Equal, and use #NationalComingOutDay.
 
 
Recognizing World Mental Health Day on October 10
 
On World Mental Health Day and beyond, let’s acknowledge the importance of identifying and creating safe and inclusive spaces where we can reach out, talk, and seek help when needed.
Remember, you’re never alone on your journey and there are helpful mental health resources dedicated to the LGBTQ+ community including Trans Lifeline, The Trevor Project, and the LGBT National Hotline.
If you’re struggling, help is available 24 hours a day by dialing 988 to the Suicide & Crisis Lifeline.
 
 
Out & Equal in the News
Our CEO, Erin Uritus: 
Is featured in a 
USA Today piece
 about the current DEI landscape and the value of inclusion and belonging.
 
Sits down with Rhodes Perry (he/him) for his 
Imagine Belonging at Work podcast
 where they discuss her personal and professional journey, the impact of Out & Equal, and the business case for LGBTQ+ inclusion.
 
Pens 
a byline for The Advocate
 on the value of bi+ inclusion in the workplace. 
Sits down with 
the Forged in Fire podcast
 to discuss her personal journey, leadership style, and how the experiences of an LGBTQ+ individual impact their approach to leadership.
 
 
 
Join the Out & Equal Community
 
Through thought leadership and partnership (advisory services, knowledge, resources, and tools) and global programs and transformative events, becoming an Out & Equal Partner will supercharge your LGBTQ+ workplace inclusion progress. 
We look forward to having you join us in the movement! 
Partner in the Business of Belonging™
Learn More
 
 
FOLLOW US
  
  
  
 
 
outandequal.org
Out & Equal | 
1111 Broadway
 3rd Floor | 
Oakland, CA 94607 US

 |

 |

subject: Applications for Ageless Innovators are open
body:
﻿
Or do you know someone who is?
Then we invite you to join Ageless Innovators!
Over 
450
 people 
have participated to date
 
Hi Ashton,
Applications are open
 for the 13th cohort of Ageless Innovators, running from January to June 2025. The 
deadline to apply
 is end of day 
Tuesday, October 8th
.
In today’s fast-paced world, innovation thrives when diverse perspectives come together. That’s why Ageless Innovators connects professionals across generations, pairing co-mentors together to unlock new ideas and creative solutions. Participants come together to learn and share experiences, building powerful partnerships that transcend age and industry.
Since its founding in 2019 by Chicago Innovation and The Village Chicago, Ageless Innovators has empowered change-makers of all ages to share skills, spark fresh thinking, and drive growth in their careers and communities. It’s Chicago’s first intergenerational co-mentoring program, supported by the RRF Foundation for Aging.
 
 
 
APPLY TODAY!
 
 
CALLING ALL PEOPLE SEEKING:
EXPERTISE: 
Learn from the insights of a different generation
 
PURPOSE: 
Give back and help your co-mentor reach their goals
 
﻿
COMMUNITY: 
Get access to a Chicago Innovation Membership during your 6-month cohort ($200 value) and a membership to the Village Chicago ($540 value)
 
TAKE PART IN MONTHLY EVENTS: 
LARGE-SCALE: 
Chicago Innovation community events with up to 750 participants 
HANDS-ON: 
intimate panels and events with industry leaders on cohort specific topics
 
There is no fee to apply. If selected into the program, there is a $200 enrollment fee. 
 
 
Top Areas of impact for Co-mentors
 
83%
﻿
of co-mentors said they were closer to their goals than they had been 6 months prior
 
 
 
"Through this program, I was able to learn about a new line of business and gain a new understanding for my co-mentors experiences."
~ Jahred Zmolek, CFO, Killerspin
 
“I loved working with a 
younger person who had so much to offer me” 
~ Gail Zelitzky | Founder, Women Over 70: Aging Reimagined podcast 
 
“The program helped me get connected to a local community of innovators in Chicago”
~ Kristoffer Kizer, Senior Associate, Client Leadership, Kantar
 
"
The purpose of Ageless Innovators is to bring people together from different generations with different perspectives who can 
unlock 
something new in each other"
~ Larry Deutsch | CEO & Co-Founder, dvk marketing
APPLY NOW TO JOIN THE NEXT COHORT
 
THANK YOU TO OUR PARTNER
 
AND GENEROUS SPONSORS!
 
 
 
Are you interested in ensuring innovation is for everyone by supporting the Ageless Innovators program? Contact 
Laura LeClair 
at
 
lauraj@chicagoinnovation.com
 
to learn more!
 
 
Chicago Innovation | 
2001 N Halsted
 Suite 201 | 
Chicago, IL 60614 US

subject: Registration is open for Uniting Generations on October 23rd at the Black Ensemble Theater
body:
Dear Ashton,
We are excited to invite you to a vibrant celebration honoring the winners of the third annual Turn the Page on Age Awards.
- Be inspired by people who are redefining the topic of aging
- Join a discussion about the power of intergenerational relationship-building
- Meet change-makers who defy traditional stereotypes and embrace life with passion, purpose, and innovation 
Whether you're 20 years old, 100 years old, or anything in between, we hope to see you for this uniquely uplifting evening.
Best, 
Luke Tanen, President and CEO, Chicago Innovation
Tom Kuczmarski, Co-founder, Chicago Innovation
Niki Fox, Executive Director, The Village Chicago
 
 
 
 
People and organizations that are combating ageism through bold achievements and dynamic reinvention
MODERATOR 
 
Mary O'Donnell
CEO, RRF Foundation for Aging
 | One of the nation's largest grant-makers that supports older adults.
2024 Turn the Page on Age Honoree
 
Marc Freedman
Founder and Co-CEO, CoGenerate
 | 
The Wall Street Journal named his most recent book —
 
How to Live Forever: The Enduring Power of Connecting the Generations
 — one of the year’s best books on aging well. 
 
2024 Turn the Page on Age Honoree
 
Emilia DiMenco
President and CEO, Women's Business Development Center |
 Presides over the largest, oldest and most comprehensive women’s business assistance center in the U.S.
2024 Turn the Page on Age Honoree
 
Don Bell
Founding Chairperson, Illinois Commission on LGBTQ+ Aging; Board Member, The Village Chicago
 |
 Challenges ageism and ableism in intersection with other forms of social marginalization as they impact the aging community.
 
Agenda
5pm-6pm: Cocktail reception
6pm-7pm: Awards and panel discussion
7pm-7:30pm: Post event networking
 
 
Black Ensemble Theater 
4450 N Clark St
Complimentary drinks and light appetizers will be served. 
 
 
 
 
The Turn the Page on Age Awards is operated by the Chicago Innovation Foundation and The Village Chicago, and funded by RRF Foundation for Aging.
 
 
Chicago Innovation | 
2001 N Halsted
 Suite 201 | 
Chicago, IL 60614 US

subject: An Exclusive Opportunity to Boost Your Metrics Skills
body:
I wanted to personally invite you to our upcoming Breakfast Club session, "Being Mindful With Metrics," happening on September 25, 2024.
Hello Ashton,
 
I wanted to personally invite you to our upcoming 
Breakfast Club session, "
Being Mindful With Metrics
,"
 happening on 
September 25, 2024.
 In today’s fast-paced, remote work environment, the need for objective metrics in managing performance has never been more crucial.
 
But as the 
2023 Future Role of the CLO
 report reveals, many leaders still feel unprepared to handle metrics and ROI effectively. That’s why this session is a must-attend — it’s all about developing better measurement strategies that can help align learning and development outcomes with your organization’s goals.
 
During this interactive session, we’ll cover:
Proven ways to demonstrate the impact of L&D outcomes
How to adjust learning metrics to better fit organizational performance
Real-world examples to help you confidently work with analytics and ROI
I’d love for you to join us for what promises to be an insightful conversation. Plus, you’ll get the chance to network with fellow learning leaders who share your challenges and aspirations.
 
Register now
 and secure your seat for this important discussion!
 
Looking forward to seeing you there.

Ashley St. John | Founder, Chief Content Officer, Editor in Chief

subject: Applications for Ageless Innovators are now open
body:
﻿
Or do you know someone who is?
Then we invite you to join Ageless Innovators!
Over 
450
 people 
have participated to date
 
Hi Ashton,
Applications are now open
 for the 13th cohort of Ageless Innovators, running from January to June 2025. The 
deadline to apply
 is end of day 
Tuesday, October 8th
.
In today’s fast-paced world, innovation thrives when diverse perspectives come together. That’s why Ageless Innovators connects professionals across generations, pairing co-mentors together to unlock new ideas and creative solutions. Participants come together to learn and share experiences, building powerful partnerships that transcend age and industry.
Since its founding in 2019 by Chicago Innovation and The Village Chicago, Ageless Innovators has empowered change-makers of all ages to share skills, spark fresh thinking, and drive growth in their careers and communities. It’s Chicago’s first intergenerational co-mentoring program, supported by the RRF Foundation for Aging.
 
 
 
APPLY TODAY!
 
 
CALLING ALL PEOPLE SEEKING:
EXPERTISE: 
Learn from the insights of a different generation
 
PURPOSE: 
Give back and help your co-mentor reach their goals
 
﻿
COMMUNITY: 
Get access to a Chicago Innovation Membership during your 6-month cohort ($200 value) and a membership to the Village Chicago ($540 value)
 
TAKE PART IN MONTHLY EVENTS: 
LARGE-SCALE: 
Chicago Innovation community events with up to 750 participants 
HANDS-ON: 
intimate panels and events with industry leaders on cohort specific topics
 
There is no fee to apply. If selected into the program, there is a $200 enrollment fee. 
 
 
Top Areas of impact for Co-mentors
 
83%
﻿
of co-mentors said they were closer to their goals than they had been 6 months prior
 
 
 
"Through this program, I was able to learn about a new line of business and gain a new understanding for my co-mentors experiences."
~ Jahred Zmolek, CFO, Killerspin
 
“I loved working with a 
younger person who had so much to offer me” 
~ Gail Zelitzky | Founder, Women Over 70: Aging Reimagined podcast 
 
“The program helped me get connected to a local community of innovators in Chicago”
~ Kristoffer Kizer, Senior Associate, Client Leadership, Kantar
 
"
The purpose of Ageless Innovators is to bring people together from different generations with different perspectives who can 
unlock 
something new in each other"
~ Larry Deutsch | CEO & Co-Founder, dvk marketing
APPLY NOW TO JOIN THE NEXT COHORT
 
THANK YOU TO OUR PARTNER
 
AND GENEROUS SPONSORS!
 
 
 
Are you interested in ensuring innovation is for everyone by supporting the Ageless Innovators program? Contact 
Laura LeClair 
at
 
laura@chicagoinnovation.com
 
to learn more!
 
 
Chicago Innovation | 
2001 N Halsted
 Suite 201 | 
Chicago, IL 60614 US

subject: Never Forget Your Power
body:
Out & Equal’s September 2024 Newsletter
 
 
 
Never Forget Your Power
It’s hard to believe that we’re just one month away from the 2024 Out & Equal Workplace Summit. We’re putting the final touches on our learning sessions, community-building activities, and unforgettable keynotes—and the entire organization is buzzing with anticipation.   
  
For me, the planning process is a reflective one. From first-time attendee in 2001, to Out & Equal Board member and now CEO, I’ve had the unique honor of experiencing Workplace Summit from many different vantage points.   
  
But one thing has remained consistent: Summit’s ability to remind us that we, as individuals and a collective, have the power to create movement-making impact. The magic of Summit is unique and multifaceted. Why? Because it connects learning and best practices to action, it reminds us why we do this work, and it builds—year after year—community that sustains us.  
  
In this complex, sometimes overwhelming landscape, I implore you to pause, breathe, and remember your power. Each of us has an individual sphere of influence that can spark a thought, discussion, or decision with an impact that extends far beyond our social and professional circles.   
 
So, don’t let inflammatory rhetoric and sensationalized news headlines dim your light and make you feel that your voice and effort can’t make a difference. That’s simply not true.   
  
Our creativity, our imagination, and our desire to create a more just, inclusive world, can help us do what might feel impossible. We can transform despair into hope, awareness to action, and stagnation to progress.  
  
With all the work that we are doing at Out & Equal to advance LGBTQ+ equity, inclusion, and belonging in the workplace, I know I’m ready to keep pushing forward—at Summit, and beyond. Are you?  
 
 
 
 
 
Registration for the 2024 Out & Equal Workplace Summit 
﻿
Closes Tomorrow, September 6
 
Register Now!
 
 
 
Representation & Recognition Matter! 
﻿
Meet Our Outie Award Finalists.
Since its inception more than 20 years ago, Out & Equal has recognized more than 100 individuals, organizational practices, and ERGs across a range of categories whose work is proven to have advanced LGBTQ+ workplace equity and belonging for all.
This year’s finalists represent an impressive group of role models made up of individuals, ERGs, organizations, and LGBTQ+ inclusion initiatives advancing representation and equity in measurable ways.
﻿
Outie Award Winners will be announced throughout the 2024 Out & Equal Workplace Summit from October 8-10.  
Meet Our Finalists
 
 
 
Celebrating the Diversity of the LGBTQ+ Community 
 
At Out & Equal, we’re proud to acknowledge and celebrate the following: 
Bi+ Visibility Week (September 16-September 23) and Bi+ Visibility Day (September 23)
According to 
research from Gallup
, 58 percent of the LGBTQ+ community identifies as bisexual. Despite these numbers, additional data from 
Pew Research
 notes that those who identify as bisexual are far less likely to come out to family and friends than their gay and lesbian counterparts.  
These numbers highlight the significant challenges in achieving acceptance and understanding for members of the bi+ community. Out & Equal’s 
About that B: Bi+ Inclusion at Work
 
report co-authored by bi+ expert and education, Robyn Ochs (she/her), helps fill in the gaps in information around bi+ identities in the workplace and provides tangible action items for employers and individuals. 
Read the Report
 
 
Latine Heritage Month begins on Sunday, September 15
﻿
The LGBTQ+ community is not a monolith. It is a tapestry of diverse and intersecting identities. And even within those like identities, there is immense diversity across thought, perspectives, lived experiences, and background.  
In a thought-provoking and insightful piece, Gabriel de la Cruz Soler (he/him), Senior Manager, Global Impact Programs (LATAM) at Out & Equal, highlights the evolution of identity within the Latin community where he notes,
 “Hispanic, Latinx, Latine, Latino, or Chicano? When it comes to labeling ourselves, there is no one correct answer. It depends on when you immigrated to the US, where you studied, where you were born, where you grew up, what your gender is, what generation you’re from, and what community you would like to be a part of.”  
Read Gabi's Blog
 
 
 
Welcome to Our New Partners! 
At Out & Equal, we work with the world's leading and most influential companies—and the inclusive leaders in these organizations—to advance LGBTQ+ representation, equity, inclusion, and belonging in the workplace. 
We’re proud to welcome
 Abt Global, Cedars-Sinai, DPR Construction, Draper, Medline Industries, LP, Pernod Ricard, Trane Technologies, Turner Construction Company, and Weber Shandwick 
as our newest members of the Out & Equal Partner Community.
 
 
 
Join the Out & Equal Community
 
Through thought leadership and partnership (advisory services, knowledge, resources, and tools) and global programs and transformative events, becoming an Out & Equal Partner will supercharge your LGBTQ+ workplace inclusion progress. 
We look forward to having you join us in the movement! 
Partner in the Business of Belonging™
Learn More
 
 
FOLLOW US
  
  
  
  
 
 
outandequal.org
Out & Equal | 
1111 Broadway
 3rd Floor | 
Oakland, CA 94607 US

subject: Chicago Innovation Monthly – August Edition
body:
Congrats to all of our 350 Nominees for this year's 
Chicago Innovation Awards!
 
 
 
 
What's Next? 
Our
 
Nominee Celebration
 
on Sept 12
 
Join us to celebrate the 350 Nominees in the running for the 23rd annual Chicago Innovation Awards. 20 of these will be honored as Chicago Innovation Award Winners on November 14th – but on September 12th, we're convening the entire incredible collective of innovative nominees and inviting you to join!
Click Here to View all Chicago Innovation Award Nominees
 
Attend the Nominee Celebration!
 
 
 
 
 
Check out all the photos from the evening!
 
 
Didn't attend the In-Gala, but want to help the Chicago Innovation 
Foundation reach even greater heights? 
Donate today
 
Watch Chicago Innovation Hall of Fame Inductee Speeches 
 
 
Christie Hefner
 - 
a Business and civic leader. From 1988-2008, she was Chairman and CEO of Playboy Enterprises, Inc. making her the longest-serving female Chairman and CEO of a U.S. public company. She has served on 20 for-profit boards and non-profit boards, including many organizations that support women in business and workplace diversity. 
 
Chef Grant Achatz
 - the Co-Owner of the Alinea Group. He is one of the most awarded and recognized chefs in the world. He has been named Best Chef in the United States by the James Beard Foundation and honored by the Time Magazine as one of the 100 Most Influential People in the World.
 
Theaster Gates
 - a world-renowned artist & social innovator. Over the past decade, he has translated the intricacies of Blackness through space theory, land development, sculpture, and performance. He founded the Rebuild Foundation, which provides art, cultural development, and neighborhood transformation in the South Side of Chicago.
 
Phil Kotler 
- an S. C. Johnson Distinguished Professor of International Marketing at Northwestern Kellogg School of Management. Known around the world as the "father of modern marketing", he has taught for over 50 years at the Kellogg School of Management. He is the author of 90 books, including Marketing Management, the most widely used textbook in marketing in the world. 
Watch Chicago Innovation Foundation 
﻿
Program Participant Speeches
 
 
Aneta Pietraszek
, Director of Fundraising at National Merit Scholar Corporation, speaks on her experience with the "Women's Mentoring Co-Op"
 
Chuck Andrews
, Chair at Vistage and 
Andrea McNeil
, Educator at the University of Illinois Extension speak on their experience in the "Ageless Innovators" mentorship program.
 
Shannon Claiborne
, Founder of Strong Community Collective, and 
Sandee Kastrul
, Co-founder and Chief Innovation Officer of i.c. stars speak on their experience with the Black and Latine mentorship program, "The Ladder"
 
8th grade Math and STEM teacher at Lincoln Elementary School in Calumet City, 
Sahar Alkhatib
, speaks on her experience introducing the Illinois Student Invention Convention (ISIC) to her students. 
 
 
Chicago student, 
Arnav Chaphalkar
, speaks on his invention, BlindSpace, which won “Best Invention of the Year” of 180,000 students competing.
 
 
 
May 21st, 2014 
– As we're fresh off a record-setting In-Gala, we think back to the early roots of our annual fundraiser. This collage captures some spirited moments from our 2014 
﻿
"Un-Gala" at Untitled Supper Club. 
 
 
 
 
 
Welcome to our 
NEW
 Chicago Innovation Sponsor!
 
 
 
Recognition Awards: Unlocking Engagement and Motivation in Your Organization
Read more 
here
 
 
 
 
Exciting News! 
We're thrilled to announce that Laura LeClair has been promoted to Director of Mentoring and Inclusion Programs at Chicago Innovation. Her innovative leadership and dedication to fostering a supportive, inclusive culture are truly inspiring!
 
 
necessary & sufficient coffee®: 
Expanding to Grow
 
 
Imagine opening your art studio, only to discover a hidden gem attached–a small storefront brimming with potential. That's what Kate Vrijmoet found in Chicago's Logan Square, a vibrant neighborhood buzzing with artistic energy. Kate saw more than just bricks and mortar. 
She saw an opportunity to connect with her community, one delicious cup of coffee at a time. That's how "necessary & sufficient coffee®" was born, nestled next to her art studio. With a vision bigger than the storefront itself, Kate expanded in2023, opening her second cafe. Making dreams a reality requires financial fuel, and connecting to that capital proved to be a challenge for Kate. 
﻿
That's where First Women's Bank stepped in. We offered a loan that enabled Kate to realize her passion and support her community-driven mission.
Kate's Website
 
Learn more about First Women's Bank and how to put your money on a mission!
CustomerCare@FirstWomens.Bank 
www.firstwomens.bank
 
 
 
Luke Tanen, President and CEO of Chicago Innovation joins Rob Hart on the WBBM Noon Business Hour with the latest on the upcoming Nominee Celebration on September 12th

subject: Illinois Student Invention Convention Nationals + Patent Award Announcement
body:
ILLINOIS STUDENT WINS 1st PLACE 
NATIONALLY OUT OF 180,000 STUDENTS
 
Each year our top student inventors from Illinois are invited to compete at the US National competition and for the first time, one of our Illinois students, 
8th grade student Arnav, earned the top award – first place overall and Most Innovative
 – out of all students who competed and the 180,000 students who participated in invention convention programming across the country. And 
as of August 22nd, 1st place in the 6th-8th grade category at Invention Convention America's!
 
Arnav’s invention BlindSpace is a device aimed at helping 
visually impaired people to explore and navigate the world independently. 
Congratulations to Arnav and all this year’s student inventors!
Did you miss the May 18th Illinois Student Invention Convention Showcase & Awards? Check out this 
2 minute video recap
 to see our inventors in action!
 
 
 
 
Illinois student Portia also took home a National award – 3rd place in the 6th grade category for her invention 
﻿
Prairie Grow!
 
 
 
FOUNDING PATENT AWARD SPONSOR THOMPSON COBURN ANNOUNCES NEW WINNERS & CELEBRATES ISSUED PATENT
 
 
2024 Patent Award Winner 
The Container Strainer 
invented by 6th grade student Ahtziri
 
2024 Patent Award Winner 
Tortoise Ramp 
invented by 4th grade student Eliana 
 
 
Since 2021, Thompson Coburn has awarded students with pro-bono design and utility patent awards. 
One of our first student winners’ from the inaugural year just received the first US issued patent for her invention the Body
²
Pillow! 
Thompson Coburn Partners Michael Parks and Sartouk Moussavi hosted Carolyn and her mother to celebrate this great achievement! 
 
 
 
VEDDER PRICE PATENT AWARD WINNERS
We are excited to announce that Vedder Price, a long time sponsor and supporter of Chicago Innovation, is our newest Patent Award sponsor providing free patenting services to our student inventors! See this year’s inaugural winners below.
 
 
 
2024 Patent Award Winner
Shoe Switcher 
Invented by 8th grade students Angel, Junior, and Daniel
﻿
 
2024 Patent Award Winner
SnoMow
 
Invented by 7th grade student Emma 
1st place winners featured across billboards & 
﻿CTA stations this month!
 
 
Thanks to our partners at Clear Channel and Intersection, our first place student 
﻿
inventors will be celebrated across billboards and CTA stations in the city!
 
 
 
 
 
 
HELP US EXPAND OUR IMPACT THIS SCHOOL YEAR
 
Know a K-8th grade teacher or after-school educator? Consider sharing the following resources:
Educator Guide
2 Minute Program Video
Educator Training Sign-up
 
Become a Partner
 
If you or your company is interested in becoming involved in this year’s program, please reach out to 
n
icole@chicagoinnovation.com
 
 
Thank you to all our partners and sponsors who 
﻿helped make this past year a success!

 Suite 201 |

body:

Wednesday, Sep 25, 2024
VIRTUAL • INTERACTIVE • NO COST
REGISTER TODAY & EARN PDC CREDITS
 
Unlock the Power of Metrics: Transform Your L&D Strategies with Data-Driven Insights
 
In today’s remote work environment, the need for effective and objective metrics to manage and assess employee performance has never been more critical. However, the BetterWork Media Group’s “2023 Future Role of the CLO” report highlights a pressing challenge: while measurement and analytics are crucial, only 8.4% of CLOs feel adequately prepared to handle these tasks.

subject: Deadline Extended for the 3rd annual Turn the Page on Age Awards
body:
Dear Ashton,
The deadline to apply for the 
third annual Turn the Page on Age Awards 
has been
 extended to August 27. 
These awards
 
celebrate innovative individuals and organizations that are combating ageism, debunking commonly held myths about aging, and promoting positive narratives around getting older.
The awards shine a light on those that are shifting attitudes and behavior that foster more age-related empathy. Individuals of ALL ages, and organizations working to amplify opportunities for older adults to thrive, are encouraged to apply.
Awardees receive:
- Recognition at the annual Turn the Page on Age Awards ceremony in October
- Free one-year membership to The Village Chicago
- Free one-year membership to Chicago Innovation
- Highlighted on WBBM Newsradio
- Promotion leading up to the Turn the Page on Age Awards
There is no fee to nominate, and self-nominations are welcome. 
 
If you or anyone you know is engaged in work that is shifting attitudes and behavior by demonstrating that age diversity fosters creativity, productivity and improved outcomes, nominate by August 27th.
 
Individuals
 
Organizations
 
Nominate Today!
 
 
Nominations close on August 27th. Winners will be celebrated at the "Uniting Generations" event on October 23rd, 2024.
 
 
Chicago Innovation | 
2001 N Halsted
 Suite 201 | 
Chicago, IL 60614 US

remarkable speakers
 leading up to the event! From now until 
Transform 2025
, taking place on March 17th - 19th, we'll get better acquainted with these outstanding visionaries, changemakers, and people-first leaders. 
What do you hope to achieve next year to impact your field or industry?
 
 
Conor Sweeney
Global Head of Talent & Development 
WeightWatchers
I look forward to continuing the necessary enablement within our employee population to ensure the necessary tools and resources are available to execute WeightWatchers transformative brand journey. 
 
 
DeRhetta Rhodes, PhD
EVP & Chief Culture Officer
Atlanta Braves
The continued conversation of the importance of culture and how it drives engagement.
 
 
Jeet Mukerji
Co-Founder & CEO 
Kinfolk
We're aiming to make AI agents that coordinate the critical yet manual actions, connections, and communications a natural extension of the People team so the team can focus on the strategic, human parts of the job.
 
 
Rocki Howard
Founder & Chief Diversiologist
Diversiology.IO
I plan to revolutionize the DEI landscape by leveraging content creation strategies to develop accessible, practical solutions for resource-constrained practitioners. 
 
 
Steven Huang
Director of Social Justice
Multidisciplinary Association for Psychedelic Studies

subject: Join Us at the 20th Anniversary of the CLO Symposium: Leading the Way in Learning!
body:
Don’t miss our 20th anniversary event! Celebrate two decades of learning leadership with keynotes, panels, and networking opportunities.
 
 
Celebrate 20 Years of Innovation and Leadership at the CLO Symposium!
 
The 20th anniversary of the CLO Symposium is a milestone celebration of two decades of innovation, leadership and learning in the corporate education sector. This year's event promises to be an inspiring and transformative experience, packed with engaging sessions, insightful discussions and networking opportunities and more. Here’s what you can expect:
 
20th Anniversary Celebration 
Join us as we celebrate two decades of empowering learning leaders. This milestone anniversary will feature special events and surprises that honor our journey and set the stage for the future of learning and development.
 
Keynote Presentations 
 
At the heart of every CLO Symposium are our main stage keynote presentations. This year, in line with our theme, "Learning Leads the Way: A People + Business Strategy for Now & the Future," we’ll welcome three inspirational keynote speakers from diverse backgrounds to offer unique perspectives on how learning can drive both people and business strategies forward.
 
CLO PowerHour/FASTtalks
Our unique take on TED Talks, these rapid-fire practitioner narratives deliver powerful insights in 15 minutes or less. Each series of talks concludes with a brief Q&A session, allowing you to delve deeper into the topics that resonate with you.
 
Panel Discussions  
Experience lively debates that provide knowledgeable dialogue and unique perspectives on the most pressing topics for L&D leaders. Our panels are designed to spark conversation and challenge conventional thinking.
 
Educational Workshops  
Drawing from the pages of Chief Learning Officer, our editorial-driven Spotlight Workshops offer an in-depth exploration of issues that matter to you, presented by fellow CLOs. Additionally, our Partner Workshops, co-presented by event partners and their corporate clients, showcase success stories and innovative solutions. 
 
Networking Opportunities 
Connect with industry peers, thought leaders and innovators during our dedicated networking sessions. Whether you're looking to share experiences, explore collaborations, or simply expand your professional circle, these opportunities are designed to foster meaningful connections.
 
Award Celebrations  
Join us as we recognize and celebrate outstanding achievements in the learning and development field. Our award ceremonies will take place the evening of Oct. 21 and 22, and will honor those who have made significant contributions to advancing corporate education and shaping the future of our industry.
 
Don’t miss this opportunity to be part of the next chapter in corporate learning. We look forward to seeing you there!
REGISTER NOW
 
Thank You to Our Sponsors!
Gold
 
 
 
 
 
Silver
 
 
BetterWork Media Group, 1 E. Erie Street, Suite 525, Unit 2025, Chicago, IL 60611

subject: Nominate for the 3rd annual Turn the Page on Age Awards
body:
Dear Ashton,
Make sure to nominate for the 
third annual Turn the Page on Age Awards
, which celebrate innovative individuals and organizations that are combating ageism, debunking commonly held myths about aging, and promoting positive narratives around getting older.
The awards shine a light on those that are shifting attitudes and behavior that foster more age-related empathy. Individuals of ALL ages, and organizations working to amplify opportunities for older adults to thrive, are encouraged to apply.
Awardees receive:
- Recognition at the annual Turn the Page on Age Awards ceremony in October
- Free one-year membership to The Village Chicago
- Free one-year membership to Chicago Innovation
- Highlighted on WBBM Newsradio
- Promotion leading up to the Turn the Page on Age Awards
There is no fee to nominate, and self-nominations are welcome. 
 
If you or anyone you know is engaged in work that is shifting attitudes and behavior by demonstrating that age diversity fosters creativity, productivity and improved outcomes, nominate by August 23rd.
 
Individuals
 
Organizations
 
Nominate Today!
 
 
Nominations close on August 23rd. Winners will be celebrated at the "Uniting Generations" event on October 23rd, 2024.
